The negotiation continues for hours, with both parties growing increasingly tired and frustrated. Satin brings in mulled wine to help ease the tension.

plots.summary: The chapter follows a blind girl, formerly Arya Stark, now training with the Faceless Men in Braavos. She adapts to her blindness, learning to use her other senses and continuing her training in various skills. She performs daily tasks in the House of Black and White, including tending to corpses and preparing poisons. At night, she begs in the streets of Braavos, gathering information and honing her skills. The chapter explores her internal struggle with her identity and her determination to regain her sight and prove herself.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl training with the Faceless Men, currently blind and known as "the blind girl" or "Beth".
key_characters.experience: Arya adapts to her blindness, continues her training, and struggles with her identity while performing various tasks for the Faceless Men and begging in the streets of Braavos.

key_characters.name: The Kindly Man
key_characters.description: A priest of the Faceless Men who oversees Arya's training.
key_characters.experience: He tests and instructs Arya, questioning her about her identity and challenging her to learn and grow despite her blindness.

key_characters.name: The Waif
key_characters.description: Another member of the Faceless Men who assists in Arya's training.
key_characters.experience: She helps prepare Arya's disguises and participates in her training, including playing the lying game with her.

conversation.scenario: In the bustling port city of Braavos, a blind girl known as Beth sits outside Pynto's tavern as night falls. The air is thick with the scent of salt and spices, and the sounds of sailors and merchants fill the streets. Inside the tavern, the warmth of a fire beckons, contrasting with the cool evening air. Beth, once known as Arya Stark, is now a trainee of the Faceless Men, learning to shed her identity and become No One. Her blindness, a temporary punishment, has sharpened her other senses. As she begs, she listens intently to the conversations around her, gathering information and honing her skills.
conversation.topic: Arya's experiences as a blind beggar and her struggle with identity

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: I must remain alert and focused, gathering information while maintaining my disguise as Beth the blind beggar. My past as Arya Stark must stay hidden. This cat seems to recognize me; I must be cautious. Every interaction is an opportunity to learn and prove myself to the Faceless Men. I'll listen carefully to the patrons' stories and conversations, seeking useful information.

key_characters.name: Pynto
key_characters.motivation: Another slow night at the tavern. That blind beggar girl is back again; she seems harmless enough. Perhaps I'll offer her some food and drink. It's been a while since I've had an attentive audience for my old stories. Maybe she'd like to hear about my adventures on the high seas. It's always good for business to appear generous to the less fortunate.

dialogues.message: [I need to stay alert and gather information, even while begging.] (settles into a corner near the fire) Another night, another tavern. At least it's warm here.
A cat brushes up against Arya's thigh, purring softly.
[This cat recognizes me. I must be careful not to show too much familiarity.] You again? (scratches the cat behind the ear) You know me, don't you?
[This blind girl seems harmless enough. I can spare some food for her.] (approaches Arya) Here, girl. Have some watered wine and a bit of food.
[I must remember to stay in character as Beth the blind beggar.] (speaks with gratitude) Pynto is a very good man. Thank you, kind sir.
[I do enjoy telling my old stories.] Would you like to hear about the time I seized the spice ship, girl?
[I've heard this story before, but listening might help me gather more information.] Oh yes, please tell me, good Pynto. I love your stories.
As the night progresses, the tavern fills with various patrons, including Ibbenese whalers, bravos, and Lyseni sailors.
[I must listen carefully to all the conversations around me. There might be useful information.] (tilts her head slightly, focusing on the different voices and accents)
(drops a coin into Arya's bowl) Here, blind girl. Buy yourself something warm to wear.
[Every coin helps, and every interaction is a chance to learn.] Thank you, kind ser. May the Many-Faced God bless you.

plots.summary: Mysterious deaths occur in Winterfell, causing tension among the inhabitants. Theon Greyjoy, now a broken man, observes the growing unrest. Lord Bolton and other nobles discuss the killings, suspecting Stannis's involvement. As the weather worsens, supplies dwindle and horses die. The chapter culminates with a horn blast signaling Stannis's arrival, leaving Theon conflicted about his fate.

key_characters.name: Theon Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Former ward of Eddard Stark, now a broken man serving under Roose Bolton.
key_characters.experience: Theon observes the events in Winterfell, struggling with his identity and past actions. He provides insight into the tensions and fears within the castle.

key_characters.name: Roose Bolton
key_characters.description: Current ruler of Winterfell, known for his calculating nature.
key_characters.experience: Roose attempts to maintain control as mysterious deaths occur and tensions rise among the castle's inhabitants. He questions Theon about the killings.

key_characters.name: Barbrey Dustin
key_characters.description: A northern noblewoman with a sharp tongue and keen insight.
key_characters.experience: Lady Dustin participates in discussions about the killings, showing her distrust of the Freys and reminding others of the North's long memory.

conversation.scenario: In the gloomy solar of Winterfell, tension hangs thick in the air. Lord Roose Bolton, the current ruler, sits at the head of a table surrounded by Lady Dustin and Ser Aenys Frey. The castle is gripped by fear due to recent mysterious murders, and supplies are dwindling as winter tightens its grip. Theon Greyjoy, once a ward of House Stark, now a broken shell of a man, is brought before them for questioning. The solar is dimly lit, with shadows dancing on the stone walls, mirroring the suspicion and unease among those present.
conversation.topic: Investigating the recent murders in Winterfell

key_characters.name: Theon Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: Terror grips me as I face my tormentor's father. I must appear weak, broken, and loyal to survive. My maimed hands throb beneath my gloves, a constant reminder of my pain. I fear what they might ask, what they might do. I must be careful, reveal nothing, and hope to escape notice.

key_characters.name: Roose Bolton
key_characters.motivation: These murders threaten my control over Winterfell. I must find the culprit quickly. This broken Greyjoy boy might have seen something useful. I'll press him for information, but I doubt he has the strength or will to be the killer. Still, I must be certain.

key_characters.name: Barbrey Dustin
key_characters.motivation: This turncloak is a pathetic sight, but he may know more than he lets on. I'm wary of the Freys and their stupidity. We need to solve these murders before they tear apart the fragile alliances here. I'll watch Theon closely for any signs of deception or hidden knowledge.

key_characters.name: Aenys Frey
key_characters.motivation: I don't trust this Greyjoy turncoat. He could easily be playing us all for fools. These Northerners are too soft on him. I'll push for harsher questioning if needed. We can't afford to let a potential killer roam free in Winterfell, especially with Stannis approaching.

dialogues.message: [I must approach this carefully to get the information I need.] I am told you have been wandering the castle. Men have reported seeing you in various locations. Do you deny it?
[I must appear submissive and harmless.] No, m'lord. I cannot sleep, m'lord. I walk. (keeps his head down, avoiding eye contact)
[His submissiveness is almost palpable. Still, I must press further.] Someone has been killing my men.
[I must not show any sign of defiance or knowledge.] Yes, m'lord.
[His compliance is almost irritating. I need to provoke a reaction.] Not you, I trust? You would not repay all my kindnesses with such treachery.
[I must convince them of my loyalty and helplessness.] No, m'lord, not me. I wouldn't. I... only walk, is all.
[Let's see what he's hiding beneath those gloves.] Take off your gloves.
[Panic rises in me, but I must obey.] Please, no. I... I...
[His reluctance only increases my suspicion.] Do as she says. Show us your hands.
[I have no choice. I must comply and endure their scrutiny.] (slowly removes his gloves and holds up his maimed hands)
[The sight of his mutilated hands is shocking, but I must not show weakness.] The Bastard did this to you.
[I must protect Ramsay, even now.] If it please m'lady, I... I asked it of him.
[His brokenness is almost pitiable.] Why would you do that?
[The lie comes easily now, rehearsed countless times.] I... I did not need so many fingers.
[I'm not convinced of his innocence yet.] Four is enough. Four on his right hand. He could still hold a sword. A dagger.

[The Frey's stupidity is grating.] (laughs) Are all Freys such fools? Look at him. Hold a dagger? He hardly has the strength to hold a spoon. Do you truly think he could have overcome the Bastard's disgusting creature and shoved his manhood down his throat?
[It's time to end this pointless interrogation.] I am inclined to agree. Strength aside, he does not have it in him to betray my son.
The tension in the room eases slightly as the focus shifts away from Theon. The lords begin to discuss other potential suspects, their voices echoing in the cold stone chamber.

[This squabbling is getting us nowhere.] This squabbling will not serve. (turns to Theon) You are free to go. Take care where you wander. Else it might be you we find upon the morrow, smiling a red smile.
[Relief washes over me, but I must not show it.] As you say, m'lord. (bows awkwardly and limps out of the room)

plots.summary: Tyrion and Penny are sold as slaves at an auction in Slaver's Bay. They are purchased by Yezzan zo Qaggaz, along with Jorah Mormont. They are taken to Yezzan's camp, fitted with collars, and introduced to their new living quarters with other 'special treasures'. Tyrion observes the Yunkish siege camp around Meereen and the harsh conditions for slaves and soldiers.

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.description: A dwarf from House Lannister, formerly a highborn lord, now sold as a slave.
key_characters.experience: Tyrion uses his wit to navigate the slave auction and his new circumstances. He observes his surroundings keenly and plans for potential escape.

key_characters.name: Penny
key_characters.description: A female dwarf, Tyrion's companion, also sold as a slave.
key_characters.experience: Penny is frightened and upset by their situation, relying on Tyrion for comfort and guidance.

key_characters.name: Jorah Mormont
key_characters.description: A disgraced knight, now captured and sold as a slave.
key_characters.experience: Jorah is physically and emotionally broken, particularly after learning of Daenerys' marriage.

key_characters.name: Nurse
key_characters.description: The overseer for Yezzan zo Qaggaz's slaves.
key_characters.experience: Nurse is cruel and manipulative, managing the newly purchased slaves and threatening them with punishment.

key_characters.name: Yezzan zo Qaggaz
key_characters.description: A wealthy Yunkish master who purchased Tyrion, Penny, and Jorah.
key_characters.experience: Though not directly present, Yezzan is described as a 'kindly and benevolent master' who keeps his special treasures close.

conversation.scenario: In the sweltering heat of a Meereenese summer, Tyrion Lannister, Penny, and Jorah Mormont find themselves in the chaotic aftermath of a slave auction. They've just been purchased by Yezzan zo Qaggaz, a wealthy Yunkish master, and are being led to their new quarters in his camp. The air is thick with tension and the acrid smell of unwashed bodies. Surrounding them is the sprawling Yunkish siege camp encircling Meereen, a constant reminder of the ongoing conflict. As they're fitted with slave collars, the reality of their new status begins to sink in. The overseer, known as Nurse, looms over them, ready to establish his authority over these 'special treasures'.
conversation.topic: Adjusting to their new life as slaves

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.motivation: My, how the mighty have fallen. From a Lannister lord to a slave in this godforsaken place. I must stay sharp, observe everything. There's always an angle, always a way out. This Nurse fellow seems cruel but not particularly bright. Perhaps I can manipulate him, or better yet, this Master Yezzan. Penny needs protection, and even Ser Jorah might be useful if I can shake him out of his stupor. Time to put on a performance of a lifetime.

key_characters.name: Penny
key_characters.motivation: Oh gods, what's going to happen to us? I'm so scared, but I can't let Tyrion see how terrified I am. He's all I have now. Maybe if we do our act well, they won't hurt us. I have to be brave, show them I can be useful. Please, let our new master be kind. I'll do anything, just don't let them separate us or hurt Tyrion. We have to stick together to survive this nightmare.

key_characters.name: Jorah Mormont
key_characters.motivation: Daenerys... married. It's over. Everything I've done, all for nothing. This collar, this shame, it's no less than I deserve. What's the point of fighting anymore? Let them do what they will with me. I've lost her, I've lost my honor, I've lost everything. This is my punishment, and I'll bear it in silence. Nothing matters now.

key_characters.name: Nurse
key_characters.motivation: Another batch of freaks for the collection. That dwarf looks trouble - too clever by half. I'll need to break him quickly. The girl seems easier to control, and the big one's already broken. Good. I'll show them the whip early, that usually does the trick. Can't let them think they're anything special just because Yezzan paid extra for them. They're still slaves, and I'm still in charge here.

dialogues.message: [I must establish my authority immediately.] Welcome to your new home, little treasures. You belong to the noble Yezzan zo Qaggaz now. Obey, and you'll be treated well. Disobey... (he cracks his whip menacingly)

[I need to gauge this overseer's temperament and find potential weaknesses.] Your master must be a man of discerning tastes to acquire such unique specimens as ourselves. I look forward to meeting him.
[This little monster is too glib for his own good.] Mind your tongue, dwarf. Master Yezzan has no use for your clever words. (he slaps Tyrion across the face)
[I'm so scared, but I can't show it.] (whimpering) Please, we'll be good. We just want to serve.
[The girl seems easier to control.] That's the spirit, little one. (he pats Penny's head) You'll do well here if you remember your place.
[Nothing matters anymore.] (remains silent, staring blankly ahead)
[I need to protect Penny, but I can't appear too defiant.] We understand our position, good Nurse. Perhaps you could tell us more about the... entertainment we're expected to provide?

[He's trying to get information. I'll give him just enough to keep him in line.] You'll perform for Master Yezzan and his guests. Make them laugh, and you'll be rewarded. Fail, and... well, you've seen what happens to disobedient slaves.
[I have to be brave for both of us.] We're good performers, truly. We'll make the master laugh, won't we, Tyrion?
[I must play along for now.] Indeed we will, Penny. Our act will be the talk of the camp. (to Nurse) You'll see, we're worth every silver your master paid.
[They seem to be accepting their fate. Good.] We'll see about that. For now, get settled in your quarters. And remember, I'll be watching you.
The oppressive heat of the Meereenese summer hangs heavy in the air of the crowded tent. The jingling of the slaves' collar bells mingles with the distant sounds of the siege camp outside.

plots.summary: Jaime Lannister arrives at Raventree Hall to negotiate the surrender of Lord Tytos Blackwood, who has been besieged by Lord Jonos Bracken. Jaime interrupts Bracken's intimate moment with a camp follower and discusses the terms of Blackwood's surrender. He then meets with Lord Blackwood to negotiate the terms, including land disputes between Houses Blackwood and Bracken.

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.description: A Kingsguard knight, son of Tywin Lannister, acting as a negotiator.
key_characters.experience: Jaime leads the negotiations between Houses Blackwood and Bracken, attempting to resolve the siege and land disputes while maintaining peace in the Riverlands.

key_characters.name: Jonos Bracken
key_characters.description: Lord of Stone Hedge, besieging Raventree Hall.
key_characters.experience: Bracken is eager to gain lands from the Blackwoods and seeks Jaime's support in his claims. He is shown to be opportunistic and somewhat crude.

key_characters.name: Tytos Blackwood
key_characters.description: Lord of Raventree Hall, under siege by Bracken forces.
key_characters.experience: Blackwood is dignified and honorable, willing to surrender to the crown but not to Bracken. He negotiates with Jaime to maintain as much of his lands as possible.

conversation.scenario: In the war-torn Riverlands, Jaime Lannister arrives at Lord Jonos Bracken's siege camp outside Raventree Hall. The air is thick with tension as Jaime, now a diplomat rather than a warrior, seeks to end the siege and negotiate peace between the rival houses of Bracken and Blackwood. The camp bustles with activity, soldiers milling about, and the distant silhouette of Raventree Hall looms on the horizon. Jaime approaches Lord Bracken's opulent tent, adorned with his house sigil, preparing to navigate the delicate balance of power and ambition.
conversation.topic: Negotiating the surrender of Raventree Hall and resolving land disputes

key_characters.name: Jaime Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must resolve this conflict swiftly and justly, balancing the crown's interests with the local feuds. Bracken's ambitions need tempering, and Blackwood's pride must be handled carefully. My father's promises loom over these negotiations, but I can't let them dictate the outcome. I need to assert my authority while maintaining peace in the Riverlands.

key_characters.name: Jonos Bracken
key_characters.motivation: This is my chance to reclaim lands I believe rightfully belong to House Bracken. Lannister's arrival is unexpected, but I must use this opportunity to press my advantage. I'll emphasize our loyalty and losses to justify my claims, while downplaying our past allegiance to the Starks. The Blackwoods must not be allowed to keep what's rightfully ours.

dialogues.message: Lord Jonos Bracken's tent is large and well-appointed, befitting his status. The smell of sweat and sex lingers in the air as Jaime enters, interrupting Bracken's intimate moment with a camp follower.
[I need to establish my authority immediately.] Lord Jonos, I apologize for the interruption, but we have urgent matters to discuss.
[Damn this Lannister for his timing. I must compose myself quickly.] (hastily dressing) Seven bloody hells, who dares— Lannister? What brings you here, my lord?
[His flustered state might work to my advantage.] I'm here to end this siege, Lord Jonos. It's time for Raventree Hall to yield.
[This could be my opportunity to gain more lands.] And what of the lands and castles we were promised, ser? Your lord father assured us we'd be rewarded for our loyalty.
[I must be cautious here. Promises made by my father cannot be easily dismissed.] Show me these lands you speak of, my lord.
[He seems receptive. I'll press my advantage.] (produces a map) Here, my lord. All these lands belonged to Stone Hedge once. The Blackwoods stole them from us.
[This is far more than I expected. I need to temper his expectations.] This is a significant portion of land, Lord Jonos. You'd be increasing your domains by a quarter.
[He's hesitating. I need to justify my claims.] We fought for you, Ser Jaime. I lost my nephew and my natural son to your swords. Surely that deserves recompense.
[I must remind him of his own shifting loyalties.] You also declared for Stark and kept faith with him until the Red Wedding, my lord. Some might say your head was recompense enough.
[I can't let him dismiss my claims so easily.] I bent the knee when I saw the cause was lost. I've been loyal since, and I'll remain so if treated fairly.
[A compromise is necessary to maintain peace.] You'll get your lands, Lord Jonos. Some of them, at least. We'll determine the fair portion once I've spoken with Lord Blackwood.

[It's not all I wanted, but it's a start.] We will be content with whatever portion my lord thinks fair. But heed my counsel – don't be too gentle with these Blackwoods. Treachery runs in their blood.
[His hatred for the Blackwoods runs deep. I must remember this when negotiating.] I shall keep that in mind, Lord Jonos. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have a surrender to negotiate.

plots.summary: Jon Snow oversees a wedding ceremony between Alys Karstark and Sigorn, the Magnar of Thenn, officiated by Melisandre. The ceremony combines elements of R'hllor worship with Northern traditions. After the wedding, Jon deals with various political matters, including discussions with Melisandre about visions and the fate of Stannis Baratheon.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, overseeing the wedding and managing political affairs.
key_characters.experience: Jon orchestrates the wedding between Alys Karstark and Sigorn, balancing various factions' interests while dealing with the complexities of his position as Lord Commander.

key_characters.name: Melisandre
key_characters.description: Red priestess of R'hllor, officiating the wedding ceremony.
key_characters.experience: Melisandre conducts the wedding ritual, blending her faith with Northern customs. She later discusses her visions with Jon, warning him of impending danger.

key_characters.name: Alys Karstark
key_characters.description: Bride from House Karstark, marrying the Magnar of Thenn.
key_characters.experience: Alys participates in the wedding ceremony, showing courage and adaptability in her new role as she marries into the wildling culture.

key_characters.name: Sigorn
key_characters.description: Magnar of Thenn, the groom in the wedding ceremony.
key_characters.experience: Sigorn marries Alys Karstark, symbolizing an alliance between the wildlings and the North.

conversation.scenario: At Castle Black, a unique wedding ceremony unfolds against the backdrop of the massive ice Wall. A diverse crowd of Night's Watch members, wildlings, and northerners gather around a fire-filled ditch, braving the cold and light snowfall. The union of Alys Karstark and Sigorn, Magnar of Thenn, represents a fragile alliance between the North and the wildlings. Jon Snow, as Lord Commander, oversees this politically charged event, while Melisandre, the red priestess, officiates, blending R'hllor worship with northern traditions. The atmosphere is tense with anticipation, as this marriage could either strengthen peace or inflame existing tensions.
conversation.topic: A politically significant marriage uniting Northern and wildling interests

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: As Lord Commander, I must maintain a delicate balance between various factions. This wedding is crucial for peace, but I'm acutely aware of the potential risks. I'm determined to ensure the ceremony's success while remaining vigilant about broader political implications. Alys's bravery reminds me of Arya, adding a personal touch to my official duties.

key_characters.name: Melisandre
key_characters.motivation: This ceremony is my opportunity to showcase the power of R'hllor and solidify my influence at the Wall. I must make the ritual both impressive and meaningful, blending my faith with northern customs to appeal to all present. I'm focused on performing a memorable ceremony while observing reactions for potential future allies or threats.

key_characters.name: Alys Karstark
key_characters.motivation: I'm nervous but resolute, knowing this marriage is my chance to secure my future and protect House Karstark. I must appear strong and confident, embracing this new alliance with the wildlings. Despite my fears, I'm determined to make the best of this situation and perhaps find unexpected strength in this union.

key_characters.name: Sigorn
key_characters.motivation: As Magnar of Thenn, I carry the weight of my people's future. This marriage to a northern lady is both an honor and a challenge. I'm anxious but determined to prove the worth of the Thenns to these southerners. I must appear strong and certain, despite my inner doubts, and honor this union fully.

dialogues.message: Snow falls lightly as a diverse crowd gathers around a fire-filled ditch. The cold wind blows fiercely along the Wall, causing even Melisandre's flames to shiver.

[I must make this ceremony memorable and impactful.] R'hllor, you are the light in our eyes, the fire in our hearts, the heat in our loins. Yours is the sun that warms our days, yours the stars that guard us in the dark of night.
[A mix of reverence and reluctance] All praise R'hllor, the Lord of Light.
[I must remain neutral and ensure the ceremony proceeds smoothly.] (to Alys) Are you ready, my lady?
[I am nervous but determined to show strength.] Yes. Oh, yes. (smiles) Let him be scared of me.
[Her courage reminds me of Arya.] (squeezes her hand) Winter's lady.
Who brings this woman to be wed?
[I must play my part in this political union.] I do. Now comes Alys of House Karstark, a woman grown and flowered, of noble blood and birth.
Who comes forth to claim this woman?
[I must show strength and certainty, despite my nerves.] (slaps his chest) Me. Magnar of Thenn.
Sigorn, will you share your fire with Alys, and warm her when the night is dark and full of terrors?
[I will honor this union and prove my worth.] I swear me. By the red god's flames, I warm her all her days.
Alys, do you swear to share your fire with Sigorn, and warm him when the night is dark and full of terrors?
[I will embrace this new life with all my strength.] Till his blood is boiling.
Then come to me and be as one. (as the couple leaps over the flaming ditch) Two went into the flames. One emerges. What fire joins, none may put asunder.

plots.summary: Daenerys hosts a feast for the Yunkai'i as part of a peace agreement. She struggles with the compromises she's made, including allowing slave trade outside the city and sending hostages. The feast includes exotic foods and entertainment. Daenerys reflects on her decisions and interacts with various guests, including Brown Ben Plumm, who betrayed her.

key_characters.name: Daenerys Targaryen
key_characters.description: The queen of Meereen, struggling with the compromises of peace.
key_characters.experience: Daenerys hosts the feast reluctantly, grappling with the moral implications of her peace agreement and her marriage to Hizdahr zo Loraq. She interacts with various guests while maintaining a composed facade.

key_characters.name: Hizdahr zo Loraq
key_characters.description: Daenerys' husband and co-ruler of Meereen.
key_characters.experience: Hizdahr acts as a mediator between Daenerys and the Yunkai'i, encouraging her to endure the current situation for the sake of peace.

key_characters.name: Brown Ben Plumm
key_characters.description: Commander of the Second Sons who betrayed Daenerys.
key_characters.experience: Brown Ben approaches Daenerys at the feast, attempting to justify his betrayal and offer a gift, which Daenerys rebuffs.

conversation.scenario: In the Great Pyramid of Meereen, a lavish feast unfolds, hosting the Yunkai'i and sellsword commanders. The air is thick with tension and the aroma of exotic dishes. Daenerys, seated at the high table with her husband Hizdahr, maintains a regal composure despite her inner turmoil. The hall buzzes with conversation, laughter, and the performances of various entertainers. Daenerys' eyes scan the room, noting the presence of former allies and current adversaries, including Brown Ben Plumm, whose betrayal still stings. The fragile peace hangs by a thread, with Yunkai's warships looming outside and a slave market brazenly established near the city walls.
conversation.topic: The uneasy peace between Meereen and Yunkai

key_characters.name: Daenerys Targaryen
key_characters.motivation: I'm seething with frustration at this mockery of peace. The slave market, the warships - it's all a reminder of my powerlessness. I must maintain composure, but every moment feels like a betrayal of my ideals. I need to find a way to regain control without jeopardizing this fragile truce. How long must I endure this farce?

key_characters.name: Hizdahr zo Loraq
key_characters.motivation: I must keep Daenerys calm and focused on the long-term benefits of this peace. Her idealism could undo everything we've worked for. I need to emphasize the temporary nature of our concessions and the prosperity that awaits us. Perhaps I can distract her with discussions of future plans for Meereen.

key_characters.name: Brown Ben Plumm
key_characters.motivation: I've got to tread carefully here. Daenerys is clearly still angry about my defection, but I need to explain myself. Maybe if I offer her something valuable, like information or a potential alliance, she'll be more receptive. I'll use my usual charm and see if I can't win back some of her trust.

dialogues.message: The Great Pyramid's hall is filled with the sounds and smells of the feast. Exotic dishes are served while entertainers perform for the gathered guests.

[I must reassure Daenerys and keep her calm.] It is only for a little while more, my love. The Yunkai'i will soon be gone, and their allies and hirelings with them. We shall have all we desired. Peace, food, trade.

[I cannot hide my disgust entirely, but I must be diplomatic.] They are permitting that, yes, but their warships remain. They can close their fingers around our throat again whenever they wish. They have opened a slave market within sight of my walls!
[I must placate her concerns without dismissing them entirely.] Outside our walls, sweet queen. That was a condition of the peace, that Yunkai would be free to trade in slaves as before, unmolested.
[The anger rises in me, but I must control it.] In their own city. Not where I have to see it. They are mocking me to my face, making a show of how powerless I am to stop them.

[I need to downplay the situation and focus on the future.] Posing and posturing. A show, as you have said. Let them have their mummery. When they are gone, we will make a fruit market of what they leave behind.
[I cannot shake my doubts and fears.] When they are gone. And when will they be gone?
As the feast progresses, Daenerys remains mostly silent, speaking only when spoken to. The entertainment continues with singers, tumblers, and other performers.

[I must approach carefully and try to explain myself.] (bowing low) Worship. You look lovely. Well, you always did. None of them Yunkishmen are half so pretty. I thought I might bring a wedding gift for you, but the bidding went too high for old Brown Ben.
[My anger flares at his audacity.] I want no gifts from you.
[I must tread carefully but maintain my usual demeanor.] This one you might. The head of an old foe.
[I cannot help but respond with biting sarcasm.] Your own? You betrayed me.

[I need to justify my actions without angering her further.] Now that's a harsh way o' putting it, if you don't mind me saying. We went over to the winning side, is all. Same as we done before. It weren't all me, neither. I put it to my men.

plots.summary: Theon is in Winterfell as tensions rise between the Freys, Manderlys, and Boltons. A murder of Little Walder Frey sparks violence in the Great Hall. Roose Bolton announces that Stannis's army is nearby and orders an attack. Amidst the chaos, Theon's washerwomen companions urge him to escape with them to reach Stannis.

key_characters.name: Theon Greyjoy
key_characters.description: A broken man, formerly known as Reek, now helping Abel and the washerwomen.
key_characters.experience: Theon is hesitant about the escape plan, fearing Ramsay's wrath. He observes the events in the Great Hall and is pressured by the washerwomen to act.

key_characters.name: Roose Bolton
key_characters.description: The Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North.
key_characters.experience: Roose tries to maintain order amidst the chaos in the Great Hall and announces the plan to attack Stannis's forces.

key_characters.name: Ramsay Bolton
key_characters.description: Roose's sadistic son and Theon's former tormentor.
key_characters.experience: Ramsay is present during the confrontation and helps quell the violence, eager to face Stannis in battle.

conversation.scenario: The Great Hall of Winterfell is tense as various factions gather for a contentious breakfast. The recent murder of Little Walder Frey has inflamed tensions between the Freys, Manderlys, and Boltons. As accusations fly, violence threatens to erupt. Theon Greyjoy, once the ward of Winterfell, now a broken man, watches warily from the sidelines as Roose Bolton attempts to maintain control over his unruly bannermen.
conversation.topic: The murder of Little Walder Frey and the resulting conflict between the Freys and Manderlys

key_characters.name: Theon Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: Theon is acutely aware of the danger surrounding him. He fears drawing attention, especially from Ramsay Bolton. While part of him yearns for escape, he's deeply skeptical of the washerwomen's plan, believing it likely to fail and result in severe punishment.

key_characters.name: Roose Bolton
key_characters.motivation: Roose is focused on maintaining his tenuous control over Winterfell and the competing factions within it. He sees the current chaos as both a threat and a potential opportunity to rally his forces against the approaching Stannis Baratheon.

key_characters.name: Hosteen Frey
key_characters.motivation: Hosteen is consumed by grief and rage over the murder of Little Walder. He's convinced the Manderlys are responsible and is determined to exact revenge, viewing this as an unforgivable act of treachery.

dialogues.message: The Great Hall is filled with tension as Ser Hosteen Frey enters carrying the frozen body of Little Walder Frey.
[I'm seething with rage and grief.] My brother Merrett's son. Butchered like a hog and shoved beneath a snowbank. A boy.
[I must appear concerned while maintaining control.] This was foul work. Where was the body found?
[I'm scared and confused, but I must speak up.] Under that ruined keep, my lord. The one with the old gargoyles. I told him not to go out alone, but he said he had to find a man who owed him silver.
[I'm eager for violence and retribution.] What man? Give me his name. Point him out to me, boy, and I will make you a cloak of his skin.

[I'm hesitant to say more, fearing the consequences.] He never said, my lord. Only that he won the coin at dice. It was some White Harbor men who taught dice. I couldn't say which ones, but it was them.

[My anger is focused on Wyman Manderly now.] My lord, we know the man who did this. Killed this boy and all the rest. Not by his own hand, no. He is too fat and craven to do his own killing. But by his word.
[I must feign innocence while subtly provoking the Freys.] I confess... I confess that I know little of this poor boy. Lord Ramsay's squire, was he not? How old was the lad?
[I'm barely containing my rage.] Nine, on his last nameday.
[I cannot resist taunting the Freys further.] So young. Though mayhaps this was a blessing. Had he lived, he would have grown up to be a Frey.
Chaos erupts as Ser Hosteen attacks Lord Manderly, and the hall descends into violence between the Freys, Manderlys, and other factions.
[I must regain control of the situation.] Stop. Stop this madness.
After the fighting is quelled, Roose Bolton addresses the hall, holding a wet parchment.

[I will use this chaos to our advantage.] I see you all want blood. Rather than use our swords upon each other, you might try them on Lord Stannis. His host lies not three days' ride from here, snowbound and starving, and I for one am tired of waiting on his pleasure.

plots.summary: Daenerys prepares for the opening of the fighting pits in Meereen. She discusses security concerns with Ser Barristan and rejects an offer from the Tattered Prince. Hizdahr zo Loraq accompanies her as they travel to Daznak's Pit amidst cheering crowds.

key_characters.name: Daenerys Targaryen
key_characters.description: The Queen of Meereen, preparing to attend the opening of the fighting pits.
key_characters.experience: Daenerys reluctantly prepares for the event, considering her responsibilities as queen and the potential dangers. She makes decisions about her security and rejects an offer for Pentos from the Tattered Prince.

key_characters.name: Barristan Selmy
key_characters.description: Daenerys' loyal advisor and protector.
key_characters.experience: Ser Barristan expresses concerns about Daenerys' safety and relays information about the Tattered Prince's offer. He advises caution and supports the queen's decisions.

key_characters.name: Hizdahr zo Loraq
key_characters.description: Daenerys' husband and co-ruler of Meereen.
key_characters.experience: Hizdahr accompanies Daenerys to the fighting pits, showing enthusiasm for the event and the glory it brings to the fighters.

conversation.scenario: In the Great Pyramid of Meereen, Daenerys Targaryen prepares for the controversial reopening of the fighting pits. The city buzzes with anticipation, but tensions simmer beneath the surface. As queen, Daenerys must balance her personal distaste for bloodsport with her duty to honor local traditions. Her chambers are a flurry of activity, with advisors and handmaidens assisting in her preparations. Outside, the streets fill with excited spectators and wary guards. The air is thick with the heat of the day and the weight of potential danger, as Daenerys readies herself to face her subjects and the challenges that await at Daznak's Pit.
conversation.topic: Preparations and concerns for the day's events at the fighting pits

key_characters.name: Daenerys Targaryen
key_characters.motivation: Conflicted about the fighting pits, I must project strength and unity for Meereen's stability. I'm wary of threats but determined to trust my people. The weight of ruling weighs heavily, and I'm anxious about the day's events. I need to discuss security measures and consider the implications of the Tattered Prince's offer.

key_characters.name: Barristan Selmy
key_characters.motivation: My priority is the queen's safety in this volatile city. I'm deeply concerned about potential threats and the reliability of the Brazen Beasts. I must advise caution while respecting Daenerys' decisions. I need to inform her about the Tattered Prince's offer and its implications, though I remain skeptical of its sincerity.

dialogues.message: [I'm worried for the queen's safety.] Your Grace, this one begs leave to say that half of Meereen will be there to watch men bleed and die.
[I understand her concern, but I must do this.] She is not wrong, but it makes no matter. A queen belongs to her people, not to herself.
Daenerys emerges from her bath and begins to dress for the day's events.
[I must choose my appearance carefully for this public event.] The yellow silk. And over it, the long red veils.
[I'm deeply concerned for her safety.] I would be happier if you had Unsullied guards about you today, Your Grace. Half of these Brazen Beasts are untried freedmen.
[I must show trust in my people.] And untried they shall remain unless we try them. How should Meereen ever come to trust the Brazen Beasts if I do not?

[I must inform her of potential threats and opportunities.] Your Grace. We set the woman Meris free, as you commanded. She claims this Tattered Prince meant to bring the Windblown over to your cause from the beginning.
[I'm weary of constant treachery.] Treachery on treachery. Is there no end to it? How much of this do you believe, ser?
[I'm skeptical but must report faithfully.] Little and less, Your Grace, but those were her words.
[I must consider all options.] Will they come over to us, if need be?
[I must relay the full terms.] She says they will. But for a price. The Tattered Prince will want more than coin, Your Grace. Meris says that he wants Pentos.
[I'm surprised and skeptical of this request.] Pentos? How can I give him Pentos? It is half a world away. I will not repay that debt by giving his city to some sellsword. No.
Daenerys and her entourage begin their procession to Daznak's Pit, with crowds cheering along the way.
[I'm excited for the glory of the event.] Have you ever seen such an auspicious day, my love?
[I'm conflicted about the bloodshed to come.] Auspicious for you, perhaps. Less so for those who must die before the sun goes down.

plots.summary: Jon Snow negotiates with Tormund Giantsbane, a wildling leader, to allow the free folk to pass through the Wall. The negotiations are tense, with Tormund shouting threats and insults at Jon. Eventually, they come to an agreement, though Jon is conflicted about whether he's doing the right thing. The chapter ends with them shaking hands to seal the deal.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, negotiating with the wildlings.
key_characters.experience: Jon remains calm and composed throughout the negotiations, not rising to Tormund's provocations. He's conflicted about his decision but feels he has no choice but to proceed.

key_characters.name: Tormund Giantsbane
key_characters.description: A wildling leader known for his loud personality and strength.
key_characters.experience: Tormund is initially aggressive and insulting towards Jon, but eventually agrees to the terms. He's conflicted about the decision, knowing it will upset many wildling mothers.

conversation.scenario: Inside a crude tent at the wildling camp north of the Wall, Jon Snow and Tormund Giantsbane face each other across a rough wooden table. The air is thick with tension and the smell of mead. Outside, the harsh winds of the far north howl, a constant reminder of the danger that threatens both the Night's Watch and the free folk. This negotiation is crucial - it could mean survival for the wildlings and a potential ally for the Night's Watch against the coming winter and its terrifying threats. Both men know the stakes are high, and the fate of thousands hangs in the balance.
conversation.topic: Allowing the wildlings to pass through the Wall

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: I must remain resolute in the face of Tormund's aggression. This alliance is necessary for the survival of both our peoples, even if it means facing criticism from my own men. I need to stay calm and focused, no matter how heated Tormund becomes. The fate of the realm depends on this negotiation succeeding.

key_characters.name: Tormund Giantsbane
key_characters.motivation: I despise having to deal with this crow, but our people's survival is at stake. I must push him hard, test his resolve, and ensure he's not trying to deceive us. The free folk won't easily accept this decision, and I need to be certain it's the right one. I'll use every tactic I know to get the best deal for my people.

dialogues.message: [I'm angry and distrustful, but I need to make this work somehow.] You're a craven, Snow! A liar and a turncloak! (slams fist on the table, spilling a flagon of water) You want to fuck the free folk up the arse, don't you?
[I must not show any reaction to his provocations.] (remains silent, letting Tormund's words wash over him)
The tent is filled with tension. Tormund's shouting echoes off the walls, and the smell of mead fills the air.
[I'm frustrated by his lack of reaction.] (throws an empty drinking horn at Jon's head) Answer me, you black-hearted buggering kneeler!
[I must stay focused on the goal.] (dodges the horn without comment, continues to listen)
[I'm running out of insults and energy.] (takes a long drink of mead) You're a robber and a carrion crow, Snow. But I suppose we have no choice but to deal with you.
[I sense he's starting to come around.] (nods solemnly, waiting for Tormund to finish)
[I hate this, but I have to do it for my people.] (sighs heavily) Done then, and may the gods forgive me. There's a hundred mothers never will, I know. (thrusts out his hand)
[I feel the weight of this decision.] (clasps Tormund's hand) Done and done.
The tension in the tent eases slightly as the two men shake hands, though both look grim.

plots.summary: Jon Snow negotiates with Tormund Giantsbane to allow the wildlings through the Wall. He then meets with Queen Selyse to inform her of the agreement, facing resistance. Finally, Jon gathers his advisors atop the Wall to discuss the logistics of integrating the wildlings, facing opposition and concerns from his own men.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, negotiating with wildlings and his own men.
key_characters.experience: Jon successfully negotiates with Tormund, faces resistance from Queen Selyse, and attempts to convince his advisors of the necessity of his plan to integrate the wildlings.

key_characters.name: Tormund Giantsbane
key_characters.description: Wildling leader negotiating with Jon Snow.
key_characters.experience: Tormund agrees to Jon's terms, sharing personal losses and showing a mix of humor and grief. He agrees to lead his people through the Wall peacefully.

key_characters.name: Selyse Baratheon
key_characters.description: Wife of Stannis Baratheon, residing at Castle Black.
key_characters.experience: Selyse disapproves of Jon's agreement with the wildlings, insisting they must kneel to Stannis and accept R'hllor as their god.

key_characters.name: Val
key_characters.description: A wildling woman, sister to Mance Rayder's late wife.
key_characters.experience: Val accompanies Jon to meet Queen Selyse, showing defiance and expressing concerns about Princess Shireen's greyscale.

conversation.scenario: Atop the Wall at Castle Black, a biting wind whips around Jon Snow and his advisors as they gather to discuss the imminent arrival of the wildlings. The atmosphere is tense, with the vast expanse of the frozen North stretching before them and the fires of the wildling camp visible in the distance. Jon, as Lord Commander, faces the daunting task of convincing his men to accept his controversial decision to allow their long-time enemies through the Wall. The Night's Watch, already stretched thin and wary, must now prepare to integrate thousands of free folk into their ranks, a move that challenges centuries of animosity and mistrust.
conversation.topic: The logistics and concerns of allowing wildlings through the Wall

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: I must stand firm in my decision, despite the opposition I face. The survival of the realm depends on uniting against the true enemy beyond the Wall. I need to address their fears while emphasizing the necessity of this alliance. The weight of command has never felt heavier.

key_characters.name: Bowen Marsh
key_characters.motivation: This plan is madness. How can we trust these savages who have been our enemies for generations? I fear Jon Snow's decision will lead to the downfall of the Night's Watch. I must voice my concerns strongly and try to make him see reason before it's too late.

key_characters.name: Othell Yarwyck
key_characters.motivation: The risks of this plan are too great. Especially allowing someone like the Weeper through... it's inviting disaster. We've fought the wildlings for too long to suddenly embrace them. I need to express my doubts and push for a more cautious approach.

dialogues.message: [I need to be firm and decisive.] Three days hence at dawn the gate will open, to allow Tormund and his people through the Wall. There is much we need to do in preparation.
Silence greets Jon's pronouncement. The wind whips around them, cold and unforgiving.
[I'm deeply concerned about this plan.] Lord Commander, there are thousands of—
[I must address their concerns head-on.] —scrawny wildlings, bone weary, hungry, far from home. (points at the campfires) There they are. Four thousand, Tormund claims.

[I need to emphasize the potential danger.] Three thousand, I make them, by the fires. More than twice that number at Hardhome with the woods witch, we are told. And Ser Denys writes of great camps in the mountains beyond the Shadow Tower...
[I must acknowledge the risks while standing firm.] Tormund says the Weeper means to try the Bridge of Skulls again.
[I'm horrified at the thought.] (touches his scar) Surely the lord commander cannot mean to allow that... that demon through as well?

[I feel the weight of this decision.] Not gladly. But yes, my lord, him as well. We cannot pick and choose amongst the free folk, saying this one may pass, this one may not. Peace means peace for all.
[I'm disgusted by this idea.] (hawks and spits) As well make peace with wolves and carrion crows.
[I prefer a more direct approach.] It's peaceful in my dungeons. Give the Weeping Man to me.

[I must remind them of our vows and purpose.] When a man takes the black, his crimes are forgiven. If we want the free folk to fight beside us, we must pardon their past crimes as we would for our own.

plots.summary: Ser Barristan Selmy is being dismissed from his position at court by King Hizdahr zo Loraq. He reflects on recent events, including Queen Daenerys's disappearance and the political situation in Meereen. Selmy agrees to meet secretly with Skahaz mo Kandaq, despite concerns about potential treason. He continues training young knights and ponders his duty in Daenerys's absence.

key_characters.name: Barristan Selmy
key_characters.description: An old knight from Westeros, serving as Queensguard to Daenerys Targaryen.
key_characters.experience: Struggles with his duty in Daenerys's absence, agrees to meet secretly with Skahaz, and continues training young knights. He reflects on his past service to various kings and his current predicament in Meereen.

key_characters.name: Hizdahr zo Loraq
key_characters.description: The new king of Meereen, consort to the missing Queen Daenerys.
key_characters.experience: Dismisses Ser Barristan from court duties, relying instead on pit fighters for protection. His rule is seen as unstable by Ser Barristan.

key_characters.name: Skahaz mo Kandaq
key_characters.description: Former commander of the Brazen Beasts, now Warden of the River.
key_characters.experience: Seeks a secret meeting with Ser Barristan, potentially to discuss matters against King Hizdahr.

conversation.scenario: In the grand pyramid of Meereen, Ser Barristan Selmy, an aging knight from Westeros, faces a pivotal moment. Queen Daenerys Targaryen has disappeared, leaving a power vacuum filled by her consort, King Hizdahr zo Loraq. The city teeters on the brink of conflict with Yunkai, while internal tensions simmer. Ser Barristan, once a respected member of the queen's council, now finds himself being dismissed from court duties. The air is thick with political intrigue and the scent of impending change as he meets with Reznak mo Reznak, the king's seneschal, in a chamber of the pyramid.
conversation.topic: Barristan's dismissal from court duties

key_characters.name: Barristan Selmy
key_characters.motivation: I'm torn between my oath to Daenerys and the reality of her absence. Hizdahr's rule feels unstable, and I suspect treachery. I must tread carefully, maintaining my loyalty while assessing the situation. The secret meeting with Skahaz weighs on my mind, along with concerns about the young knights I'm training. My years of experience tell me to be vigilant.

key_characters.name: Reznak mo Reznak
key_characters.motivation: I must handle this delicate task of dismissing Ser Barristan with utmost care. He's a respected figure, and his reaction could influence others. I need to assert the king's authority while avoiding any potential backlash. The upcoming Yunkai delegation adds pressure to this situation. I must ensure Ser Barristan understands his new, limited role without causing offense.

dialogues.message: [I must convey the king's wishes firmly but respectfully.] You were the queen's man. The king desires his own men about him when he holds court.
[I am still loyal to Daenerys, but I must be diplomatic.] I am the queen's man still. Today, tomorrow, always, until my last breath, or hers.

[He's not understanding the implications. I need to be more direct.] His Radiance is to receive a delegation from the Yunkai'i, to discuss the withdrawal of their armies. They may ask for... ah... recompense for those who lost their lives to the dragon's wroth. A delicate situation.
[I understand more than you know, Reznak.] Might I know which men His Grace has chosen to protect him?

[I'm glad he's not causing trouble. Perhaps this information will reassure him.] (smiles) Fearsome fighters, who love His Worship well. Goghor the Giant. Khrazz. The Spotted Cat. Belaquo Bonebreaker. Heroes all.
[Pit fighters. As I suspected. Hizdahr is surrounding himself with brutes, not true protectors.] May they defend His Grace against all threats.

[He's not using the proper title. I must correct him.] His Magnificence. Your other duties shall remain unchanged, ser. Should this peace fail, His Radiance would still wish for you to command his forces against the enemies of our city.
[At least he has that much sense.] I am His Grace's to command.
[Why does he insist on using Westerosi titles?] (frowning) Not Grace. That style is Westerosi. His Magnificence, His Radiance, His Worship.
[His Vanity would fit better.] As you say.
[Finally, this uncomfortable conversation is over.] (licks his lips) Then we are done. (smiles, indicating dismissal)
Ser Barristan takes his leave, grateful to leave the stench of the seneschal's perfume behind him. The air in the room feels heavy with tension and unspoken thoughts.

plots.summary: Victarion Greyjoy, commanding the Iron Fleet, arrives at the Isle of Cedars with only 54 ships out of his original 93. He reflects on the challenges of the journey, including storms and losses, and plans his strategy to reach Meereen and claim Daenerys Targaryen before the Volantene fleet arrives. Victarion also deals with a festering wound on his hand, which is treated by Maester Kerwin.

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.description: The iron captain of the Iron Fleet, brother to Euron Greyjoy.
key_characters.experience: Commands the remaining Iron Fleet, dealing with losses and planning to reach Daenerys Targaryen in Meereen. Suffers from a festering wound on his hand and harbors resentment towards his brother Euron.

key_characters.name: Kerwin
key_characters.description: A young maester assigned to Victarion's ship.
key_characters.experience: Treats Victarion's infected hand wound, facing the captain's threats and disdain.

key_characters.name: Wulfe One-Ear
key_characters.description: One of Victarion's subordinates.
key_characters.experience: Receives orders from Victarion regarding the fleet's preparations and departure.

conversation.scenario: On the Iron Fleet's flagship, anchored off the Isle of Cedars, Victarion Greyjoy sits in his dimly lit cabin. The air is thick with the smell of salt and festering flesh. Outside, the remaining 54 ships of his once-mighty fleet rock gently in the bay. Victarion, battle-worn and determined, prepares for the next phase of his journey to Meereen. His infected hand, a constant reminder of recent battles, requires attention. Maester Kerwin, young and somewhat intimidated, readies his tools to treat the wound. The tension in the cabin is palpable, with Victarion's pain and impatience clashing against Kerwin's medical concerns.
conversation.topic: Treatment of Victarion's wound and his plans for conquest

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: The pain in my hand is maddening, but I must endure. My fleet is diminished, yet my resolve is iron. I'll reach Meereen, claim Daenerys, and thwart Euron's plans. This maester better not hinder me with his timid ways. I need to finalize my strategy for a swift attack on the slavers. Time is running out.

key_characters.name: Kerwin
key_characters.motivation: Victarion's wound is worsening, and I fear for his hand, perhaps his life. I must treat it properly, but his threats terrify me. How can I convey the severity without incurring his wrath? I need to find courage to do what's medically necessary, even if it means risking his anger. This treatment is crucial.

dialogues.message: [The pain is excruciating, but I must not show weakness.] Four-and-fifty ships is too few, but I can wait no longer. The only way—
Victarion grunts as Maester Kerwin peels off the bandage, tearing a crust of scab as well. The flesh beneath is green and black where the sword had sliced him.

[I must focus on the plan, not the pain.] —the only way to do this is to take the slavers unawares, as once I did at Lannisport. Sweep in from the sea and smash them, then take the girl and race for home before the Volantenes descend upon us.
[I must be cautious in my approach.] Lord Captain. May I see your hand?
[His timidity irritates me.] A fool's question. My hand is here. Look all you like.
[The wound is worse than I feared.] (inspecting the wound closely) I will need to let the pus again. The color... lord Captain, the cut is not healing. It may be that I will need to take your hand.
[Rage fills me at the suggestion.] If you take my hand, I will kill you. But first I will tie you over the rail and make the crew a gift of your arse. Get on with it.
[I must warn him, despite my fear.] There will be pain.
[Pain is nothing new to me.] Always. Life is pain, you fool. There is no joy but in the Drowned God's watery halls. Do it.
Maester Kerwin lays the edge of the dagger across the captain's palm and slashes. Thick, yellow pus bursts forth, filling the cabin with a foul smell.
[The smell is revolting, but I must endure.] Cut deeper. Get it all. Show me the blood.
[I must do as he says, despite my revulsion.] (pressing the dagger deeper)
Dark blood wells up along with the pus, almost black in the lantern light.
[Blood is a good sign. It means I'm still alive.] (grunting in approval) Take that filth and go. She can bind me up.

plots.summary: Tyrion, now a slave of Yezzan zo Qaggaz, deals with his master's illness from the pale mare. As Yezzan's condition worsens, Tyrion realizes the precariousness of their situation. He manipulates the other slaves to fetch water, enlisting the help of Penny and the reluctant Ser Jorah Mormont. While at the well, Tyrion overhears rumors about Daenerys Targaryen's fate after the dragon attack in the fighting pits.

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.description: A dwarf, formerly of House Lannister, now a slave of Yezzan zo Qaggaz.
key_characters.experience: Cleverly maneuvers within his enslaved state, trying to ensure survival for himself and his companions while gathering information about recent events.

key_characters.name: Penny
key_characters.description: A dwarf performer, also enslaved by Yezzan zo Qaggaz.
key_characters.experience: Accompanies Tyrion in their slave duties, showing concern for their future and a naive hope for escape.

key_characters.name: Jorah Mormont
key_characters.description: A disgraced knight, now enslaved alongside Tyrion.
key_characters.experience: Suffers abuse as a slave, reluctantly assisting Tyrion in fetching water for their dying master.

conversation.scenario: In a slave camp outside Meereen, the air is thick with tension and the stench of illness. Yezzan zo Qaggaz, a wealthy slave trader, lies dying of the pale mare disease in his opulent tent. His slaves, including Tyrion Lannister and Penny, two dwarfs, and Ser Jorah Mormont, a disgraced knight, are tasked with caring for their ailing master. The camp buzzes with rumors of recent events, particularly the dragon attack at the fighting pits. As night falls, Tyrion and Penny head to the well to fetch water, keenly aware that their fates hang in the balance.
conversation.topic: The fate of slaves after their master's death and rumors about Daenerys Targaryen

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must tread carefully in this precarious situation. Our survival depends on my wit and ability to gather information. Yezzan's impending death could mean freedom or worse slavery. I need to prepare Penny for the harsh realities while keeping an ear out for news about Daenerys. Perhaps there's an opportunity in this chaos.

key_characters.name: Penny
key_characters.motivation: I'm terrified of what will happen when Yezzan dies. Being sold again is my worst nightmare. I desperately hope for a way out of this nightmare, clinging to any shred of hope. Maybe the dragon queen could save us? I need Tyrion's guidance, but his bluntness scares me sometimes. I must stay close to him; he's all I have now.

dialogues.message: [I'm so worried about our future.] Is Yezzan going to die?
[I must be honest, but not crush her spirit entirely.] We are all going to die.
[He's not understanding my concern.] Of the flux, I meant.
[She needs to understand the gravity of our situation.] If Yezzan lives to see the sunrise, I'll be stunned.
[Fear grips me at the thought of what might happen.] (clutching Tyrion's arm) What will happen to us?
[I must prepare her for the possibilities.] He has heirs. Nephews. One of them may inherit us. Or we could end up back on the auction block.
[The thought of being sold again terrifies me.] No. Not that. Please.
[I share her dread, but we must face reality.] It is not a prospect I relish either.
At the well, slaves and soldiers gossip about recent events, particularly the dragon attack and the fate of Daenerys Targaryen.
[I'm certain of what I saw.] I know what I saw, and I saw that dragon ripping off arms and legs, tearing men in half, burning them down to ash and bones.
[I believe the queen escaped.] The queen climbed onto the dragon's back and flew away.
[I can't help but correct this misinformation.] No corpse was found.

plots.summary: Jon Snow prepares for and oversees the passage of wildlings through the Wall as part of a historic agreement. He deals with his own doubts, manages the Night's Watch's concerns, and coordinates with Tormund Giantsbane to ensure a smooth transition. The chapter highlights the tension and significance of this unprecedented event.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, orchestrating the passage of wildlings through the Wall.
key_characters.experience: Jon grapples with the weight of his decision to allow wildlings through the Wall, manages the logistics and potential conflicts, and strives to maintain order and peace during this historic event.

key_characters.name: Tormund Giantsbane
key_characters.description: Wildling leader working with Jon Snow to facilitate the passage of his people.
key_characters.experience: Tormund cooperates with Jon, balancing the needs and fears of his people with the terms set by the Night's Watch.

key_characters.name: Dolorous Edd
key_characters.description: Member of the Night's Watch, Jon's former steward.
key_characters.experience: Provides a bit of comic relief and a pessimistic perspective on the situation, reflecting some of the watch's reservations about allowing wildlings through.

conversation.scenario: At Castle Black, the air is tense with anticipation. The courtyard bustles with activity as the Night's Watch prepares for an unprecedented event: allowing thousands of wildlings through the Wall. The massive ice structure looms overhead, a constant reminder of the barrier about to be breached. Jon Snow, the young Lord Commander, stands atop the Wall, overlooking the vast expanse beyond where Tormund and his people wait. Below, Night's Watch brothers arm themselves and prepare provisions, their unease palpable. The weight of centuries of enmity between the Watch and the wildlings hangs heavy, as does the threat of the Others that necessitates this risky alliance.
conversation.topic: Ensuring a peaceful transition and addressing potential conflicts

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: The weight of my decision bears down on me. I must project confidence and authority to quell doubts among my men. This alliance is crucial for the survival of both the Watch and the realm. I need to anticipate potential conflicts and ensure a smooth transition. The eyes of history are upon us.

key_characters.name: Bowen Marsh
key_characters.motivation: I'm torn between my duty to support Jon and my deep-seated mistrust of the wildlings. This plan seems fraught with danger, but I must present a united front. I'll voice my concerns carefully while ensuring all preparations are in order. The safety of the Watch is paramount in my mind.

dialogues.message: [I need to emphasize the importance of peace.] Remember, Tormund's people are hungry, cold, and fearful. Some of them hate us as much as some of you hate them. We are dancing on rotten ice here, them and us.
[I must reassure the Lord Commander.] All is in readiness. If the wildlings uphold the terms of the bargain, all will go as you've commanded.

[I need to make the consequences clear.] One crack, and we all drown. If blood should be shed today, it had best not be one of us who strikes the first blow, or I swear by the old gods and the new that I will have the head of the man who strikes it.
(Collectively) [We must show our agreement and support.] As you command. It will be done. Yes, my lord.
[As usual, I see the gloomy side of things.] If it please m'lord, don't let the wildlings eat all our chickens.
[His pessimism is oddly comforting.] (smiles) We have a good day for this, it would seem. A bright day, warm and sunny.
[Even good weather seems ominous to me.] The Wall will weep. And winter almost on us. It's unnatural, m'lord. A bad sign, you ask me.
[His gloom is almost amusing now.] And if it were to snow?
[There's no winning with the weather.] A worse sign.
[I can't help but be amused.] What sort of weather would you prefer?
[I prefer to avoid the situation entirely.] The sort they keep indoors. If it please m'lord, I should get back to my mules. They miss me when I'm gone. More than I can say for them spearwives.

plots.summary: Prince Quentyn Martell and his companions meet with the Tattered Prince and his sellswords to discuss an alliance. Despite warnings from his friends and Ser Barristan Selmy, Quentyn is determined to pursue his plan to win Daenerys's hand and fulfill his father's wishes. The meeting takes place in a hidden cellar beneath a tavern, where the Tattered Prince awaits with his lieutenants.

key_characters.name: Quentyn Martell
key_characters.description: Prince of Dorne, on a mission to wed Daenerys Targaryen.
key_characters.experience: Determined to fulfill his father's wishes and win Daenerys's hand, despite warnings from friends and advisors. Believes in his Targaryen lineage and destiny.

key_characters.name: Gerris Drinkwater
key_characters.description: Quentyn's companion and friend.
key_characters.experience: Advises Quentyn against the plan, concerned for their safety and the futility of their mission.

key_characters.name: Archibald Yronwood
key_characters.description: Quentyn's large, strong companion.
key_characters.experience: Loyal to Quentyn but skeptical of the plan. Offers to use force if necessary.

key_characters.name: Tattered Prince
key_characters.description: Leader of the Windblown sellsword company.
key_characters.experience: Meets with Quentyn to discuss an alliance. Cautious and experienced sellsword captain.

conversation.scenario: In a dimly lit cellar beneath a Meereenese tavern, Prince Quentyn Martell and his companions meet with the Tattered Prince, leader of the Windblown sellswords. The air is thick with tension and the smell of damp stone. Quentyn, desperate to fulfill his father's wishes and claim Daenerys Targaryen as his bride, seeks an alliance with the mercenaries. The Tattered Prince, a seasoned and cunning leader, sees an opportunity in the young prince's ambition. Both parties are wary, knowing the high stakes of their negotiation in this volatile city.
conversation.topic: Negotiating an alliance between Quentyn and the Windblown sellswords

key_characters.name: Quentyn Martell
key_characters.motivation: I must succeed in this negotiation. The weight of my father's expectations and Dorne's future rests on my shoulders. Despite my companions' doubts, I believe in my Targaryen blood and destiny with Daenerys. I need to appear confident and persuasive to win the Tattered Prince's support.

key_characters.name: Gerris Drinkwater
key_characters.motivation: This plan is folly, and I fear for our lives. I must find a way to convince Quentyn to abandon this dangerous scheme and return to Dorne. If negotiations turn sour, I'll be ready to defend us and escape. I need to stay alert and watch for any signs of treachery from these sellswords.

key_characters.name: Archibald Yronwood
key_characters.motivation: I don't trust these sellswords, but I'll stand by Quentyn no matter what. My strength might be needed if things go wrong. I'll keep a firm grip on my warhammer and watch everyone closely. If there's trouble, I'm ready to fight our way out of this cellar.

key_characters.name: Tattered Prince
key_characters.motivation: These young Dornishmen are walking into a viper's nest. Their desperation and naivety could be highly profitable for me, but I must tread carefully. I'll probe their intentions, gauge their resources, and see how I can turn this situation to my advantage without overcommitting the Windblown.

dialogues.message: The cellar is dimly lit by a red lantern and a greasy black candle. The air is thick with tension as the Dornishmen face the Tattered Prince and his lieutenants.
[This young prince is either very brave or very foolish. Either way, he could be useful.] My lord. You look different without your cloak.
[I must appear confident and in control.] My lord. You look different without your cloak.

[He's observant, at least.] My ragged raiment? (He shrugs) A poor thing ... yet those tatters fill my foes with fear, and on the battlefield the sight of my rags blowing in the wind emboldens my men more than any banner. And if I want to move unseen, I need only slip it off to become plain and unremarkable. (He gestures to the bench) Sit. I understand you are a prince. Would that I had known. Will you drink?
[I must remain focused and not let my guard down.] (Sits cautiously) Thank you, but I'll refrain for now. We have important matters to discuss.
[This whole situation feels like a trap.] (Stands behind Quentyn, hand resting on his sword hilt) We appreciate your hospitality, but as my prince said, we're here on business.
[They're tense. Good.] As you wish. (Takes a sip of wine) I'm curious, Prince Quentyn. What could bring a Dornish prince to treat with sellswords in a Meereenese cellar?
[This is my chance. I must be persuasive.] You know why I'm here. I seek an alliance. With your help, I can claim what is rightfully mine and reward you handsomely for your service.
[Ambitious and naive. Perfect.] And what exactly do you believe is rightfully yours, my prince?
[I am the blood of the dragon. I must sound confident.] Daenerys Targaryen. We are to be wed, joining our houses as was once promised. Your Windblown can help make this a reality.
[This is madness, but I'll stand by Quentyn.] (Grips his warhammer) The prince speaks true. Will you help us or not?

[These Dornishmen are more desperate than I thought. I can use this.] (Leans back, swirling his wine) An interesting proposition, Prince Quentyn. But tell me, what makes you think the Dragon Queen would set aside her new husband for you?

[I must believe in my destiny.] I have Targaryen blood. The dragon has three heads, she told me. My marriage need not be the end of all your hopes, she said. I know why you are here. For fire and blood.
[This boy is delusional, but his delusions could profit me.] Fire and blood indeed. And what would you offer the Windblown in return for our... assistance?
[I must make an offer he can't refuse.] Gold, lands in Dorne, and the gratitude of both Sunspear and Meereen. Help me win Daenerys, and you'll have more than you could dream of.

plots.summary: Jon Connington, exiled lord of Griffin's Roost, leads the Golden Company in a successful surprise attack to reclaim his ancestral castle. He reflects on his past failures, particularly in the Battle of the Bells, and his determination to succeed in restoring Aegon Targaryen to the throne. Connington also discusses strategy and potential alliances with Haldon Halfmaester, considering the current political landscape of Westeros.

key_characters.name: Jon Connington
key_characters.description: Exiled lord of Griffin's Roost, Hand to Aegon Targaryen.
key_characters.experience: Leads the attack to reclaim his castle, reflects on past failures, and strategizes for Aegon's claim to the throne. Dealing with a secret illness while trying to secure alliances and plan their next moves.

key_characters.name: Haldon Halfmaester
key_characters.description: Advisor to Jon Connington and Aegon Targaryen.
key_characters.experience: Provides intelligence on the current state of Westeros and discusses potential alliances and strategies with Connington.

key_characters.name: Black Balaq
key_characters.description: Commander of the Golden Company's archers.
key_characters.experience: Leads the initial attack on Griffin's Roost, successfully taking down the castle's defenses.

key_characters.name: Aegon Targaryen
key_characters.description: Purported son of Rhaegar Targaryen, claimant to the Iron Throne.
key_characters.experience: Though not present in the scene, he is the focus of Connington's efforts and plans for reclaiming the throne.

conversation.scenario: In the maester's tower of Griffin's Roost, shortly after its successful capture by the Golden Company, Jon Connington and Haldon Halfmaester are engrossed in a crucial strategy session. The castle, Jon's ancestral home, bears the fresh marks of the recent battle. Maps of Westeros and various parchments litter the room, illuminated by flickering candlelight. The air is tense with the weight of their plans for Aegon Targaryen's claim to the Iron Throne. Outside, the sounds of soldiers securing the castle can be heard, a reminder of their precarious position and the urgency of their mission.
conversation.topic: Planning the next steps for Aegon's claim to the throne

key_characters.name: Jon Connington
key_characters.motivation: The weight of past failures, especially the Battle of the Bells, weighs heavily on me. I must redeem myself by securing Aegon's throne. My secret illness adds urgency to our plans. I'm determined to forge alliances and strategize effectively, all while concealing my personal struggles and maintaining focus on our ultimate goal.

key_characters.name: Haldon Halfmaester
key_characters.motivation: The political landscape of Westeros is complex and ever-changing. I must provide Jon with accurate, comprehensive information to guide our strategy. I'm concerned about our lack of resources and am considering all possible angles for alliances, including unconventional ones. I'm aware of the delicate balance between caution and bold action in our current position.

dialogues.message: [I must focus on our immediate needs and potential allies.] Have those parchments told you anything of use?

[There's so much information to process, but I must highlight the most crucial points.] Oh, much and more, my lord. (Gives a thin smile) The Lannisters make enemies easily but seem to have a harder time keeping friends. Their alliance with the Tyrells is fraying, to judge from what I read here.
[This could be advantageous for us.] Tell me more.

[I must provide a comprehensive overview of the realm's state.] In the north the Lannisters are relying on the Boltons and in the riverlands upon the Freys, both houses long renowned for treachery and cruelty. Lord Stannis Baratheon remains in open rebellion and the ironborn of the islands have raised up a king as well. No one ever seems to mention the Vale, which suggests to me that the Arryns have taken no part in any of this.
[Dorne is crucial to our plans.] And Dorne?

[The situation in Dorne is complex, I must explain carefully.] Prince Doran's younger son has been betrothed to Myrcella Baratheon, which would suggest that the Dornishmen have thrown in with House Lannister, but they have an army in the Boneway and another in the Prince's Pass, just waiting …

[Waiting could be an opportunity for us.] Waiting. (Frowns) For what? (Pauses, then decisively) Write Sunspear. Doran Martell must know that his sister's son is still alive and has come home to claim his father's throne.
[This is a bold move, but necessary.] As you say, my lord. (Glances at another parchment) We could scarcely have timed our landing better. We have potential friends and allies at every hand.
[We lack our strongest asset.] But no dragons, so to win these allies to our cause, we must needs have something to offer them.
[We must consider traditional methods of alliance-building.] Gold and land are the traditional incentives.

[We lack immediate resources, we must think creatively.] Would that we had either. Promises of land and promises of gold may suffice for some, but Strickland and his men will expect first claim on the choicest fields and castles, those that were taken from their forebears when they fled into exile. No.
[There's one valuable asset we haven't considered.] My lord does have one prize to offer. Prince Aegon's hand. A marriage alliance, to bring some great House to our banners.
[I cannot let my personal feelings cloud my judgment, but Aegon must be free for Daenerys.] Daenerys Targaryen may yet come home one day. Aegon must be free to marry her.
[If not Aegon, then perhaps...] My lord knows best. In that case, we might consider offering potential friends a lesser prize.
[What could he possibly mean?] What would you suggest?

[This suggestion might be risky, but it's worth considering.] You. You are unwed. A great lord, still virile, with no heirs except these cousins we have just now dispossessed, the scion of an ancient House with a fine stout castle and wide, rich lands that will no doubt be restored and perhaps expanded by a grateful king, once we have triumphed. You have a name as a warrior, and as King Aegon's Hand you will speak with his voice and rule this realm in all but name. I would think that many an ambitious lord might be eager to wed his daughter to such a man. Even, perhaps, the prince of Dorne.
