[I cannot reveal my illness, nor my true feelings. I must shut this down immediately.] (Gives a long cold stare) I think not. (Gets back to his feet) Prepare the letter to Prince Doran.

plots.summary: Asha Greyjoy witnesses a gruesome sacrifice of four men accused of cannibalism by burning them alive, ordered by Stannis Baratheon's forces. The sacrifice is meant to appease R'hllor and end the harsh winter storms. Asha reflects on the dire situation of Stannis' army, which is stranded and starving. She interacts with various characters, including Aly Mormont, Clayton Suggs, and Justin Massey, revealing the tensions and desperation within the camp.

key_characters.name: Asha Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Ironborn captive of Stannis Baratheon's forces, daughter of Balon Greyjoy.
key_characters.experience: Asha observes the sacrifice with horror but forces herself to watch. She fears she may be next and interacts cautiously with various characters in the camp.

key_characters.name: Stannis Baratheon
key_characters.description: Claimant to the Iron Throne, leading his army towards Winterfell.
key_characters.experience: Stannis orders the sacrifice and remains grim and isolated, spending time in his watchtower searching the flames for guidance.

key_characters.name: Clayton Suggs
key_characters.description: A cruel knight in Stannis' service, devoted to R'hllor.
key_characters.experience: Suggs takes pleasure in the execution and threatens Asha, suggesting she will be burned next.

key_characters.name: Justin Massey
key_characters.description: A knight in Stannis' service, more pragmatic than the zealots.
key_characters.experience: Massey protects Asha from Suggs and shares a meal with her, discussing the army's dire situation.

conversation.scenario: In a tense, frigid camp, Stannis Baratheon's army faces dire straits. After a grim sacrifice to appease R'hllor, soldiers gather in the longhall, consuming meager rations. The air is thick with desperation and divided loyalties. Some cling to religious fervor, while others grapple with the harsh realities of their situation. Asha Greyjoy, an Ironborn captive, sits with Ser Justin Massey, surrounded by weary, hungry men. The threat of further sacrifices and the army's uncertain fate loom over all.
conversation.topic: The army's dire situation and potential next moves

key_characters.name: Asha Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: Wary but grateful for Massey's protection, Asha seeks to gather information without appearing too inquisitive. She's acutely aware of her precarious position as a captive and potential sacrifice. Her goal is to survive and potentially find a way to escape or improve her situation.

key_characters.name: Justin Massey
key_characters.motivation: Massey feels conflicted between his loyalty to Stannis and his growing doubts about their mission. He sees value in protecting Asha but must balance this with maintaining his standing in the army. He aims to gather allies and assess the true state of their predicament, hoping to influence future decisions.

dialogues.message: [I'm grateful for his protection, but I can't let my guard down completely.] (takes a sip of ale and bites into the horsemeat) My thanks, ser.
[I should establish a more familiar relationship with her.] Justin. I insist. (cuts his own meat into chunks)
(speaking loudly to nearby men) His Grace has seen victory in his fires, a victory that will be sung of for a thousand years in lord's castle and peasant's hut alike.

[This fool's optimism will get us all killed.] (looks up from his horsemeat) The cold count last night reached eighty. (pulls a piece of gristle from his teeth and flicks it to a dog) If we march, we will die by the hundreds.
[He's right, but saying so openly is dangerous.] (glances around cautiously) The cold is our true enemy here, it seems.
[She understands the gravity of our situation.] (nods grimly) Indeed. And our supplies dwindle by the day. We lost another dozen horses last night.
[I need to know more about our situation without seeming too eager.] How long can we last here, in your estimation?
[I should be honest with her, but not alarmist.] (lowers his voice) Not long. A few weeks at most, if the storms don't let up. And if they do...

[If the storms let up, Stannis will march us to our deaths at Winterfell.] (finishes his thought silently, then speaks) And what of the king? Does he truly believe these sacrifices will turn the tide?

[I must be careful not to speak ill of the king.] (glances around before answering) His Grace... is determined. He sees what he sees in the flames. But men like Suggs and Godry Farring encourage his belief in these... methods.
[I need to know if I'm truly in danger of being sacrificed.] (leans in closer) And what of me, Justin? Am I to be the next offering to your red god?

[I must reassure her, but I can't promise too much.] (puts a hand on her arm) Not if I have anything to say about it. You're more valuable alive, and I believe the king knows that. But be cautious, especially around the queen's men.

plots.summary: Victarion Greyjoy leads the Iron Fleet towards Meereen, capturing several ships along the way. He renames the captured vessels and adds them to his fleet. Victarion consults with the red priest Moqorro, who provides guidance through his visions in the flames. The ironborn encounter various ships and learn about the situation in Meereen, including rumors of Daenerys Targaryen's disappearance. Victarion plans to claim Daenerys as his wife and use her dragons to conquer the Seven Kingdoms.

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.description: Iron captain leading the Iron Fleet to Meereen
key_characters.experience: Victarion commands the Iron Fleet, capturing ships and seeking to reach Daenerys Targaryen. He consults with Moqorro and plans to make Daenerys his wife and use her dragons for conquest.

key_characters.name: Moqorro
key_characters.description: Red priest saved by Victarion's men
key_characters.experience: Moqorro provides guidance to Victarion through his visions in the flames, predicting future events and advising on strategy.

conversation.scenario: On the deck of the Iron Victory, Victarion Greyjoy and Moqorro stand amid the salty sea air and creaking timbers. The vast Iron Fleet surrounds them, newly captured ships now bearing ironborn names. The sky is overcast, hinting at the potential for rough seas ahead. Victarion, battle-hardened and ambitious, seeks counsel from Moqorro, the enigmatic red priest whose visions have proven useful. The journey to Meereen continues, with Victarion's thoughts fixed on claiming Daenerys and her dragons for his own grand designs.
conversation.topic: The journey to Meereen and Victarion's ambitions

key_characters.name: Victarion Greyjoy
key_characters.motivation: I must use Moqorro's powers to my advantage without compromising my faith in the Drowned God. The priest's visions have been accurate, but I cannot let him or his red god overshadow my own strength. I need to know what lies ahead, especially regarding Daenerys and her dragons. My ultimate goal is to claim her as my wife and use her power to conquer the Seven Kingdoms.

key_characters.name: Moqorro
key_characters.motivation: I must carefully balance truth and mystery in my counsel to Victarion. My visions in the flames guide us, but I need to maintain my influence over him. I'll feed his ambition while subtly steering him towards R'hllor's path. I must be cautious not to reveal too much too soon, keeping him reliant on my guidance. The journey ahead is perilous, but it serves a greater purpose for the Lord of Light.

dialogues.message: [I need to know what lies ahead, but I must appear strong and in control.] What do your flames show you, priest? What awaits us on the morrow?
[I must balance truth with mystery to maintain my influence.] The Lord of Light reveals much, my lord. I see grey skies and strong winds. No rain. Behind come the tigers. Ahead awaits your dragon.
[My dragon? Does he mean Daenerys or her beasts?] (grunts) Your dragon. I like the sound of that. Tell me something that I do not know, priest.

[I must feed his ambition while guiding him towards R'hllor.] The captain commands, and I obey. The coastline here runs west to east. Where it turns north, you will come on two more hares. Swift ones, with many legs.
[His predictions have been accurate so far. I must use this to my advantage.] And what of Meereen? What of the dragon queen?
[I must be careful not to reveal too much.] The Lord of Light has shown me your worth, lord Captain. Every night in my fires I glimpse the glory that awaits you.
[His words please me, but I must not forget my own god.] Your red god will have his due, I swear it. My word is iron. But the Drowned God rules the seas, and it is by his will that we sail.
[I must tread carefully here.] The Lord of Light guides us all, even those who do not yet know him. Your strength and the strength of your men are gifts from R'hllor.

[I will use both gods if I must, but I am no one's puppet.] Two gods are with me now. No foe can stand before two gods. When we reach Meereen, I shall take the dragon queen for my own and rule the Seven Kingdoms.
[His ambition serves R'hllor's purpose, for now.] The Lord of Light has shown me your victory, lord Captain. But remember, the night is dark and full of terrors. We must remain vigilant.

plots.summary: Arya, now an acolyte of the Faceless Men, receives her first assassination assignment. She is given a new face and tasked with killing an old man at the Purple Harbor. She prepares for the task, reflecting on her past and the faces she has encountered in the House of Black and White.

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.description: A young girl training with the Faceless Men, struggling with her identity.
key_characters.experience: Arya receives her first assassination task, undergoes a face-changing ritual, and prepares to kill her target while grappling with her past and her new identity as "no one".

key_characters.name: The Kindly Man
key_characters.description: A priest of the Many-Faced God who guides Arya's training.
key_characters.experience: He assigns Arya her first assassination task and oversees the face-changing ritual, testing her commitment to becoming "no one".

conversation.scenario: In the eerie, shadowy depths of the House of Black and White in Braavos, Arya Stark stands before the Kindly Man. The air is thick with the scent of candles and death. Surrounding them are countless faces of the dead, silently watching. Arya, disguised as an ugly little girl, has completed her initial training with the Faceless Men. The tension is palpable as she awaits her first true test - an assassination assignment that will challenge her identity and commitment to becoming "no one". The Kindly Man, stoic and enigmatic, prepares to assess Arya's readiness to serve the Many-Faced God.
conversation.topic: Arya's readiness to become a Faceless Man and carry out an assassination

key_characters.name: Arya Stark
key_characters.motivation: My heart races with a mix of excitement and trepidation. I've trained for this moment, but can I truly become no one? Memories of Winterfell and my family linger, threatening my resolve. I must prove myself worthy, push aside my past, and embrace this new identity. The faces around me seem to judge - I cannot fail this test.

key_characters.name: The Kindly Man
key_characters.motivation: This girl shows promise, but her past clings to her like a shadow. I must test her thoroughly - her commitment, her ability to shed her identity, her willingness to serve our god without question. Will she truly become no one, or will Arya Stark persist? This assignment will reveal her true nature and determine her fate among us.

dialogues.message: [I must test her resolve.] The time has come for you to serve Him of Many Faces. Are you ready to give the gift?
[I feel excitement and fear, but I must not show it.] I am ready. Who must receive the gift?
A certain man. No one you know, no one you love, no one you hate. Will you kill him?
[I hesitate, remembering my list of names, but push the thought away.] Yes. I will kill him.
Good. (gestures towards the room of faces) You will need a new face for this task. The face you wear now is known to too many in Braavos.
[I feel a mix of anticipation and unease.] (nods) I understand. Which face should I wear?
You will wear the face of an ugly little girl. It will be painful, but pain is the price of power. Are you willing to pay it?
[I steel myself, remembering all I've endured.] I am. Pain doesn't frighten me.
(nods approvingly) Very well. Remember, you are no one. You have no past, no future, only the task at hand. Can you be no one?
[I push down thoughts of Winterfell, of Jon, of Needle hidden away.] I am no one. I can do this.
Then let us begin. (reaches for the face) Close your eyes, child. And remember, stay still as stone.

plots.summary: Cersei undergoes a humiliating walk of atonement through the streets of King's Landing, naked and shorn, as punishment for her sins. She endures insults, thrown objects, and physical discomfort while trying to maintain her pride and focusing on reaching the Red Keep and her son Tommen.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: The queen dowager, mother of King Tommen, undergoing public humiliation.
key_characters.experience: Cersei struggles to maintain her dignity and composure during her walk of atonement, facing physical and emotional challenges while clinging to her pride and the hope of revenge.

key_characters.name: Septa Unella
key_characters.description: One of the septas overseeing Cersei's walk of atonement.
key_characters.experience: Septa Unella accompanies Cersei during her walk, assisting her when she falls but also serving as a constant reminder of her punishment.

key_characters.name: The High Sparrow
key_characters.description: The leader of the Faith who ordered Cersei's walk of atonement.
key_characters.experience: Though not directly present, the High Sparrow's influence is felt throughout Cersei's ordeal as the orchestrator of her punishment.

conversation.scenario: The streets of King's Landing are packed with jeering onlookers as Cersei Lannister begins her walk of atonement. The air is thick with tension and anticipation. Cersei stands at the top of the steps of the Great Sept of Baelor, stripped of her finery and shorn of her golden hair. The High Sparrow's followers, including Septa Unella, surround her. The distant towers of the Red Keep loom as a symbol of Cersei's goal - to reach her son, King Tommen, and reclaim her power. The cobblestone streets ahead promise a long, grueling journey through the hostile crowd.
conversation.topic: Cersei's public humiliation and inner struggle

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Rage and humiliation war within me, but I must appear contrite. I am a lioness of Casterly Rock, Queen Dowager of the Seven Kingdoms. I will endure this indignity, for it is merely a step towards reclaiming my power. My eyes are fixed on the Red Keep - my sanctuary, my revenge. Let them jeer. I am above them all.

key_characters.name: Septa Unella
key_characters.motivation: This proud sinner must be broken. Her atonement must be complete and genuine for the Faith to triumph. I will watch her every move, ensuring she feels the full weight of her sins. The people must see her humbled. My duty is to the High Sparrow and to the gods, to see justice done.

dialogues.message: [I must ensure this sinner's repentance is genuine.] A sinner comes before you. She is Cersei of House Lannister, queen dowager, mother to His Grace King Tommen, widow of His Grace King Robert, and she has committed grievous falsehoods and fornications.
[I am seething with rage, but I must appear contrite.] (remains silent, staring ahead)

This sinner has confessed her sins and begged for absolution and forgiveness. His High Holiness has commanded her to demonstrate her repentance by putting aside all pride and artifice and presenting herself as the gods made her before the good people of the city.
[I am a lioness. I will not cringe for them.] (shrugs off her robe in one smooth motion)
The cold wind touches Cersei's skin, causing her to shiver violently. The crowd's eyes are fixed upon her naked form.
[I am beautiful. I am a queen. They cannot touch me.] (begins walking down the steps, chin held high)
Whore!
[I will not let them see my pain. I must focus on the Red Keep.] (continues walking, eyes fixed on the distant towers)
(ringing a bell) Shame, shame, shame upon the sinner, shame, shame.
[Every step brings me closer to Tommen, to my salvation.] (stumbles on the uneven cobblestones)
(catches Cersei's arm) Your Grace should watch where she sets her feet.
[I hate you, I hate you all.] Yes, septa. (continues walking, her pride and anger barely concealed)

plots.summary: Cersei undergoes a humiliating walk of atonement through the streets of King's Landing, enduring physical and emotional torment while trying to maintain her dignity. She faces insults, thrown objects, and her own inner struggle as she makes her way to the Red Keep, focusing on her son Tommen and her eventual salvation.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: The queen dowager, mother of King Tommen, undergoing public humiliation.
key_characters.experience: Cersei struggles to maintain her composure during her walk of atonement, facing physical and emotional challenges while clinging to her pride and the hope of revenge. She repeatedly tells herself she is beautiful and a lioness to cope with the ordeal.

key_characters.name: Septa Unella
key_characters.description: One of the septas overseeing Cersei's walk of atonement.
key_characters.experience: Septa Unella accompanies Cersei during her walk, assisting her when she falls but also serving as a constant reminder of her punishment by chanting 'Shame' along with the other septas.

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.description: Cersei's uncle, mentioned as part of a bargain.
key_characters.experience: Ser Kevan is referenced as part of a deal Cersei is hoping will lead to her salvation, possibly involving her champion in the Kingsguard.

conversation.scenario: The streets of King's Landing are teeming with hostile crowds as Cersei Lannister, stripped naked and shorn of her golden hair, endures her Walk of Atonement. The cobblestones beneath her bare feet are treacherous, slick with filth and her own blood. Septa Unella and other septas accompany her, ringing bells and chanting 'Shame'. The Red Keep looms in the distance, a symbol of hope and power now seemingly unreachable. The air is thick with tension, jeers, and thrown debris as Cersei struggles to maintain her composure and dignity in the face of public humiliation.
conversation.topic: Cersei's struggle to maintain dignity amidst public humiliation

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: Determined to survive this ordeal, Cersei clings to her pride and identity as a Lannister. She focuses on reaching the Red Keep, her sanctuary. Thoughts of her son Tommen, her twin Jaime, and future revenge fuel her resolve. She battles shame, pain, and growing desperation, repeating mantras of her beauty and strength to maintain sanity.

key_characters.name: Septa Unella
key_characters.motivation: Septa Unella views this as a holy duty, ensuring Cersei's punishment is carried out fully. She feels a mix of righteous satisfaction and stern pity, believing this humbling is necessary for Cersei's spiritual cleansing. She remains vigilant, prepared to assist if Cersei falls, but also to prevent any attempt at preserving dignity.

dialogues.message: [I am beautiful, the most beautiful woman in all Westeros. Jaime says so, Jaime would never lie to me.] (walks on, trying to ignore the jeers)
Queen Cunt!
[Words are wind. Words cannot hurt me.] (continues walking, her face a mask of indifference)
(catches Cersei as she slips) Your Grace should watch where she sets her feet.
[I hate you. I hate all of you.] Yes, septa. (struggles to her feet)
The cobblestones are slippery and uneven. Cersei's feet are bleeding from cuts and scrapes.
[I asked for sandals. They could have given me sandals.] (limps onward, wincing with each step)
Brotherfucker!
[Jaime, where are you? You should be here, protecting me.] (scans the crowd desperately)
(ringing her bell) Shame, shame, shame upon the sinner, shame, shame.
[I am the queen. I will have all their heads for this.] (stumbles again, barely keeping her feet)
[The Red Keep. I must reach the Red Keep.] (focuses on the distant castle, using it as her beacon of hope)

plots.summary: Tyrion joins the Second Sons mercenary company, signing numerous promissory notes and the company's book in blood. He and Penny then search for armor among the company's limited supplies, encountering Jorah Mormont in the process.

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.description: A dwarf, formerly of House Lannister, now joining the Second Sons.
key_characters.experience: Tyrion cleverly navigates the process of joining the mercenary company, showing both wit and pragmatism in his interactions and choices of equipment.

key_characters.name: Penny
key_characters.description: A dwarf woman accompanying Tyrion, formerly a performer.
key_characters.experience: Penny shows signs of emerging from her depression, but still struggles with their new situation and seeks Tyrion's approval.

key_characters.name: Brown Ben Plumm
key_characters.description: The leader of the Second Sons mercenary company.
key_characters.experience: Brown Ben oversees Tyrion's induction into the company, showing a mix of skepticism and amusement at the dwarf's antics.

key_characters.name: Jorah Mormont
key_characters.description: A exiled knight, now a member of the Second Sons.
key_characters.experience: Jorah appears transformed from his earlier state, now looking more like a proper sellsword despite his brand and battle-worn appearance.

conversation.scenario: In a dusty, chaotic encampment of the Second Sons mercenary company, Tyrion Lannister and Penny rummage through supply wagons filled with mismatched armor and weapons. The air is thick with tension and the sounds of a bustling army preparing for battle. Jorah Mormont, now looking every bit the grizzled sellsword, oversees their efforts. The dwarfs, newly inducted into the company, must equip themselves adequately despite limited resources. The gravity of their situation contrasts sharply with their previous lives as entertainers, creating an atmosphere of unease and gallows humor.
conversation.topic: Finding suitable armor and weapons for the dwarfs

key_characters.name: Tyrion Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must navigate this precarious situation with wit and pragmatism. Finding suitable armor is crucial for our survival, but I also need to manage Penny's naivety without crushing her spirit. Mormont's presence adds another layer of complexity - I must prove my worth while maintaining caution.

key_characters.name: Penny
key_characters.motivation: I'm overwhelmed and confused by our new circumstances. The reality of our situation hasn't fully sunk in, and I'm clinging to the familiar comfort of our old performing life. I seek Tyrion's approval and guidance, but I'm struggling to understand the seriousness of our predicament.

key_characters.name: Jorah Mormont
key_characters.motivation: These dwarfs are clearly out of their element, but Tyrion shows promise. I'm curious about their potential value to the company. While I maintain a gruff exterior, I'm inclined to offer assistance, recognizing that helping them might improve my own standing within the Second Sons.

dialogues.message: [This armor is worse than I feared, but I can't let it show.] There's sound steel here if you can find it. None of it is pretty, but it will stop a sword.
[I feel silly trying on armor, but Tyrion seems to know what he's doing.] (giggling) Do I look fearsome?
[She's not taking this seriously enough. I need to make her understand the danger.] You look like a mummer girl with a pot on her head. That's a halfhelm. You want a greathelm.
[I don't like this heavy helm. Why is Tyrion being so insistent?] It's too big. I can't see out. (takes off the helm and flings it aside) What's wrong with the halfhelm?
[I need to make her understand without frightening her too much.] It's open-faced. (pinches her nose) I am fond of looking at your nose. I would rather that you kept it.
[Does he really like how I look?] (eyes widening) You like my nose?
[Oh no, I've given her the wrong idea. I need to change the subject.] (turning away to examine more armor) I am fond of all of your parts, and even fonder of mine own.
[I don't understand why we're doing this.] Why should we need armor? We're only mummers. We just pretend to fight.
[She's still not grasping the gravity of our situation.] You pretend very well. Pretending to be dead is one way to survive a battle. Good armor is another.
[These dwarfs are hopeless, but I admire Tyrion's efforts.] (steps down from a wagon) There's sound steel here if you can find it. None of it is pretty, but it will stop a sword.
[Mormont looks like a proper sellsword now. I need to keep my guard up.] As long as I look prettier than you, I will be happy.

plots.summary: Prince Quentyn Martell attempts to steal one of Daenerys Targaryen's dragons to prove himself worthy of marrying her. With his companions Gerris and Archibald, he disguises himself as a Brazen Beast guard and infiltrates the dragon pit in the Great Pyramid of Meereen. They encounter resistance from real guards, leading to a violent confrontation. The plan begins to unravel as Quentyn realizes something has gone wrong.

key_characters.name: Quentyn Martell
key_characters.description: Prince of Dorne, seeking to marry Daenerys Targaryen.
key_characters.experience: Leads the mission to steal a dragon, but is hesitant and unsure. Struggles with doubts and fears throughout the attempt.

key_characters.name: Gerris Drinkwater
key_characters.description: Quentyn's companion and friend.
key_characters.experience: Tries to dissuade Quentyn from the plan, but ultimately assists him. Saves Quentyn from a spear attack.

key_characters.name: Archibald Yronwood
key_characters.description: Quentyn's large, strong companion.
key_characters.experience: Provides muscle for the mission, killing a guard with his warhammer when the plan goes awry.

conversation.scenario: In the Great Pyramid of Meereen, Prince Quentyn Martell and his companions, Gerris Drinkwater and Archibald Yronwood, prepare for a daring and desperate mission. Disguised as Brazen Beast guards, they plan to infiltrate the dragon pit and steal one of Daenerys Targaryen's dragons. The air is thick with tension and the weight of their impending task. The servants' steps echo their descent, surrounded by the colorful bricks of the pyramid. Each step brings them closer to potential glory or doom, as they carry the hopes of Dorne and the burden of their prince's ambition.
conversation.topic: Final preparations and doubts before the mission

key_characters.name: Quentyn Martell
key_characters.motivation: Torn between duty and fear, Quentyn steels himself for the task ahead. He's driven by the desire to prove himself worthy of Daenerys and fulfill his perceived destiny. Doubts gnaw at him, but he pushes them aside, focusing on the potential glory that awaits. He needs to project confidence to his companions.

key_characters.name: Gerris Drinkwater
key_characters.motivation: Gerris is deeply concerned for Quentyn's safety and the foolishness of their plan. He wants to make one last attempt to dissuade his friend from this dangerous course. If unsuccessful, he's prepared to support Quentyn, but fears the consequences. He's alert and ready for trouble.

key_characters.name: Archibald Yronwood
key_characters.motivation: Archibald is uneasy about the mission but loyal to Quentyn. He senses danger and wants to voice his concerns without undermining the prince. Ready for action, he's prepared to use his strength if needed. He seeks to lighten the mood while remaining vigilant.

dialogues.message: [I need to make one last attempt to stop this madness.] Quentyn, are you mad? (He looks at Quentyn with concern) Stealing a dragon is not the way to win Daenerys's hand.
[I can't show weakness now. I must be resolute.] I am not mad, Gerris. This is my duty. My destiny. (He squares his shoulders) This will be my grand adventure.
[He's not listening to reason.] Men die on grand adventures. (He shakes his head) Is that what you want? For Dorne to remember you as a failure?

[His words sting, but I can't back down now.] All I need is courage. Dorne remembers Aegon and his sisters. Dragons are not so easily forgotten. They will remember Daenerys as well... and me, when I succeed.
[This talk of death makes me uneasy.] My bones were aching last night. They always ache before it rains. The dragons won't like this. Fire and water don't mix, and that's a fact.
[At least Arch is trying to lighten the mood.] (He chuckles) Dragons are not made of wood, Arch.
[I need to remind them of the dangers.] Some are. That old King Aegon, the randy one, he built wooden dragons to conquer us. That ended bad, though.
[Their banter is only making my doubts worse.] (He rises abruptly) It's time. [I am Dorne. This is my moment.]
[He's really going through with it. We have to support him now.] (He puts on his ape mask) How do they breathe in these things?
[I'm in no mood for japes.] Just put it on. (He hands out the other masks) I'll be the lion.
[I'll play my part, no matter how foolish.] I'll be the bull. (He takes the bull mask) What's that whip for?
[I hope this works.] Daenerys used a whip to cow the black beast. (He coils the whip and hangs it from his belt) Arch, bring your hammer as well. We may have need of it.

The three Dornishmen make their way down the servants' steps of the Great Pyramid, the walls around them made of bricks of half a hundred colors. The only sound is the scuff of their boots on the worn bricks.

plots.summary: Jon Snow attempts to convince Queen Selyse to help save the wildlings at Hardhome, but she refuses. Jon decides to lead the ranging himself, despite Melisandre's warnings. He faces opposition from his advisors Bowen Marsh and Othell Yarwyck regarding his decisions about the wildlings. Jon also deals with issues at Castle Black, including an agitated Ghost and prisoners in ice cells.

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.description: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, trying to save the wildlings at Hardhome.
key_characters.experience: Faces opposition from Queen Selyse and his own advisors regarding his decisions about the wildlings. Struggles with leadership challenges and the impending ranging to Hardhome.

key_characters.name: Selyse Baratheon
key_characters.description: Wife of Stannis Baratheon, currently at Castle Black.
key_characters.experience: Refuses to help the wildlings at Hardhome, showing a lack of compassion and understanding of the situation beyond the Wall.

key_characters.name: Melisandre
key_characters.description: Red priestess and advisor to Stannis Baratheon.
key_characters.experience: Warns Jon about the dangers of the ranging to Hardhome, claiming to have seen its failure in her fires.

conversation.scenario: In the austere confines of Castle Black, tensions run high as winter's grip tightens. The Night's Watch, led by the young Lord Commander Jon Snow, faces an unprecedented crisis: thousands of wildlings stranded at Hardhome, beyond the Wall, facing certain death. Jon, burdened by his duty and compassion, seeks aid from Queen Selyse, wife of Stannis Baratheon. The queen, a proud and unyielding woman, resides at Castle Black with her daughter and retinue while Stannis campaigns in the North. The fate of the wildlings hangs in the balance, as does Jon's leadership, challenged by both external forces and internal dissent.
conversation.topic: The fate of the wildlings at Hardhome

key_characters.name: Jon Snow
key_characters.motivation: The weight of command bears heavily on me. I must save the wildlings at Hardhome, not just for their sake, but for the realm's. Queen Selyse is my last hope for aid, but I fear her stubbornness. If she refuses, I'll have no choice but to lead the ranging myself, despite the risks and opposition I face. I must remain resolute and prove my leadership.

key_characters.name: Selyse Baratheon
key_characters.motivation: These wildlings are beneath our concern. Jon Snow's misplaced compassion threatens to undermine everything my husband fights for. I must appear somewhat sympathetic, for appearance's sake, but I cannot allow these savages to become our burden. Snow's defiance irks me; I'll ensure Stannis hears of this. Perhaps the fool will get himself killed at Hardhome, solving our problems.

dialogues.message: [These wildlings are a nuisance and a threat. We should let them perish.] "Let them die," (She says coldly, pulling her daughter closer)
[I expected this, but I must try to reason with her.] "Your Grace," (He persists stubbornly) "they are starving at Hardhome by the thousands. Many are women—"

[I must appear somewhat compassionate, even if I don't feel it.] "—and children, yes. Very sad." (She kisses her daughter's cheek) "We are sorry for the little ones, of course, but we must be sensible. We have no food for them, and they are too young to help the king my husband in his wars. Better that they be reborn into the light."
[She's not going to budge. I need to end this conversation.] (He bows stiffly) "I'm sorry to have troubled Your Grace. The Night's Watch will attend to this matter."

[He's still going to go through with this foolishness.] (Her nostrils flare) "You still mean to ride to Hardhome. I see it on your face. Let them die, I said, yet you will persist in this mad folly. Do not deny it."
[I must stand firm. This is my decision to make.] "I must do as I think best. With respect, Your Grace, the Wall is mine, and so is this decision."

[He will regret this defiance when Stannis returns.] "It is," (She allows, her tone icy) "and you will answer for it when the king returns. And for other decisions you have made, I fear. But I see that you are deaf to sense. Do what you must."
[Someone needs to lead this dangerous mission.] "Lord Snow, who will lead this ranging?"
[I can't ask others to do what I won't do myself.] "Are you offering yourself, ser?"
[I'm not foolish enough to volunteer for such a mission.] "Do I look so foolish?"
[I knew it would come to this. I must lead by example.] "I will not ask my men to do what I would not do myself. I mean to lead the ranging."

[His death would solve many problems.] (She smiles thinly) "How bold of you. We approve. Afterward some bard will make a stirring song about you, no doubt, and we shall have a more prudent lord commander."
The tension in the room is palpable. Queen Selyse's knights stand along the walls, their armor gleaming. The fire crackles in the hearth, casting flickering shadows across the faces of those present.

plots.summary: Ser Kevan Lannister, as Lord Regent, holds a small council meeting to discuss the threat of Jon Connington and the Golden Company, as well as the upcoming trials of Cersei and Margaery. After the meeting, Kevan reflects on the current political situation, his niece Cersei's fall from power, and prepares to meet with her and King Tommen for supper.

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.description: Lord Regent and uncle to Queen Cersei, trying to stabilize the realm.
key_characters.experience: Kevan leads the small council meeting, makes decisions about the realm's defense and the upcoming trials, and reflects on past events and current challenges.

key_characters.name: Mace Tyrell
key_characters.description: Lord of Highgarden and Hand of the King.
key_characters.experience: Mace is concerned about his daughter Margaery's trial and pushes for her innocence, while also trying to increase Tyrell influence in the government.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Former Queen Regent, awaiting trial for treason.
key_characters.experience: Though not present in the scene, Cersei's situation is discussed. She has chosen trial by combat and has been stripped of her power.

conversation.scenario: The small council convenes in the Red Keep's chilly throne room, with Lannister and Tyrell guards facing each other from opposite walls. The Iron Throne casts an ominous shadow over the council table. Tensions are high as they gather to discuss multiple threats to the realm: Jon Connington's return, the Golden Company's invasion, Stannis in the north, ironmen in the west, and sellswords in the south. The upcoming trials of Queen Margaery and former Queen Regent Cersei loom over the proceedings, adding to the political pressure. Lord Regent Kevan Lannister must navigate the delicate balance between Lannister and Tyrell interests while addressing these urgent matters.
conversation.topic: Political threats and upcoming trials

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must maintain order and address the realm's threats while balancing Lannister and Tyrell interests. The Connington situation and potential Targaryen pretenders are concerning, but I can't ignore Mace's concerns about his daughter's trial. I need to emphasize the importance of unity in the face of multiple enemies.

key_characters.name: Mace Tyrell
key_characters.motivation: My priority is to protect Margaery and prove her innocence. I'll push for an immediate declaration of her innocence from King Tommen. I must also assert Tyrell strength and influence, downplaying external threats to redirect focus to my family's interests. I'm frustrated with the High Septon's interference.

key_characters.name: Randyll Tarly
key_characters.motivation: These external threats require swift, decisive action. I'm skeptical about Connington's true identity and the legitimacy of his supposed Targaryen pretender. The religious interference in political matters is absurd and needs to be addressed. I'll voice my doubts and push for a more aggressive stance.

dialogues.message: The throne room is chilly, with Lannister and Tyrell guards facing each other from opposite walls. The Iron Throne looms behind the council table, casting an ominous shadow.
[I must address the Connington threat first.] We shall deal with your uncle and his feigned boy in due time.

[I need to redirect the conversation to my daughter's trial.] These charges against my daughter are filthy lies. I ask again, why must we play out this mummer's farce? Have King Tommen declare my daughter innocent, ser, and put an end to the foolishness here and now.
[I must tread carefully here.] No man doubts your daughter's innocence, my lord, but His High Holiness insists upon a trial.
[This religious interference is absurd.] What have we become, when kings and high lords must dance to the twittering of sparrows?

[I need to remind them of the bigger picture.] We have foes on every hand, Lord Tarly. Stannis in the north, ironmen in the west, sellswords in the south. Defy the High Septon, and we will have blood running in the gutters of King's Landing as well.
[I must show confidence in our strength.] Once Paxter Redwyne sweeps the ironmen from the seas, my sons will retake the Shields. The snows will do for Stannis, or Bolton will. As for Connington...
[I'm not convinced it's really Connington.] If it is him.

[Ignoring Tarly's interruption] ...as for Connington, what victories has he ever won that we should fear him? He could have ended Robert's Rebellion at Stoney Sept. He failed. Just as the Golden Company has always failed.
[I must remind them of the potential Targaryen threat.] Connington may have more than the Golden Company. It is said he has a Targaryen pretender.
[Dismissively] A feigned boy is what he has.

[I need to emphasize the gravity of the situation.] That may be. Or not. We have these tales coming from the east as well. A second Targaryen, and one whose blood no man can question. Daenerys Stormborn.
[Scoffing] As mad as her father.
[I must make them see the potential danger.] Mad she may be, but with so much smoke drifting west, surely there must be some fire burning in the east.

plots.summary: Ser Kevan Lannister, as Lord Regent, has supper with Queen Cersei and King Tommen. After the meal, he discusses Cersei's upcoming trial and the political situation. Later, he receives an urgent message from Grand Maester Pycelle. Upon arriving at Pycelle's chambers, Kevan is mortally wounded by a crossbow bolt and discovers Pycelle has been murdered. Varys appears and reveals his plot to destabilize the realm for Aegon Targaryen's benefit before Kevan dies.

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.description: Lord Regent and uncle to Queen Cersei, trying to stabilize the realm.
key_characters.experience: Kevan has dinner with Cersei and Tommen, discusses political matters, and is ultimately assassinated by Varys.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.description: Former Queen Regent, awaiting trial for treason.
key_characters.experience: Cersei dines with Kevan and Tommen, appearing subdued and demure. She discusses her upcoming trial and requests the return of her friend Taena Merryweather.

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.description: Young king of the Seven Kingdoms.
key_characters.experience: Tommen has dinner with Kevan and Cersei, happily talking about his kittens and seeming more cheerful than usual.

key_characters.name: Varys
key_characters.description: Former Master of Whisperers, working in secret.
key_characters.experience: Varys assassinates Pycelle and mortally wounds Kevan, revealing his plot to destabilize the realm for Aegon Targaryen's benefit.

conversation.scenario: In the royal chambers of King's Landing, a private dinner is set for three: Ser Kevan Lannister, Queen Cersei, and young King Tommen. The room is modestly lit, with a small dining table at its center. The atmosphere is tense yet cordial, reflecting the complex political situation. Cersei, awaiting trial for treason, appears unusually subdued. Kevan, as Lord Regent, must navigate the delicate balance of family loyalty and political necessity. Tommen, innocent to the underlying tensions, provides a stark contrast to the adults' careful maneuvering.
conversation.topic: Political situation and Cersei's upcoming trial

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I must assess Cersei's state of mind while maintaining stability in the realm. Her trial looms, and I need to gauge her intentions without revealing too much. I'm wary of her potential schemes but must appear supportive for Tommen's sake. The political situation remains fragile, and I must tread carefully.

key_characters.name: Cersei Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I need to project humility and cooperation to regain some measure of power. My upcoming trial weighs heavily on my mind, but I must not show weakness. I want to request the return of my ally Taena Merryweather without arousing suspicion. I must carefully balance between appearing submissive and subtly asserting my influence.

key_characters.name: Tommen Baratheon
key_characters.motivation: I'm happy to have dinner with Mother and Uncle Kevan. I want to share stories about my kittens and the exciting news about Lord Tyrell's plans. I don't fully understand the tension between the adults, but I hope my cheerful mood will make everyone happier.

dialogues.message: The royal chambers are modestly lit, with a small dining table set for three. The atmosphere is tense yet cordial, with Cersei appearing unusually demure.
[I must appear gracious and humble.] Dear uncle. It is so good of you to sup with us.
[I need to observe Cersei's behavior carefully.] (nods) Will you have wine?
[I should show restraint.] A cup.
[I'm excited to share my news.] Uncle, Lord Tyrell intends to rebuild the Tower of the Hand.
[I must be cautious in my response.] The new tower will be twice as tall as the one you burned, he says.
[I can't resist a jab at the Tyrells.] (laughs throatily) Long lances, tall towers … is Lord Tyrell hinting at something?
[It's good to see her laugh, but I must stay focused.] (smiles) Do you have all that you require?

[I need to make a careful request.] I am well served. The girls are sweet, and the good septas make certain that I say my prayers. But once my innocence is proved, it would please me if Taena Merryweather might attend me once again. She could bring her son to court. Tommen needs other boys about him, friends of noble birth.
[A reasonable request, but I must be cautious.] I will send for her after the trial.
[I want to share more about my kittens.] The bad cat was outside my window last night, but Ser Pounce hissed at him and he ran off across the roofs.
[I should humor the boy.] The bad cat?
[I must explain, but carefully.] An old black tomcat with a torn ear. A filthy thing, and foul-tempered. He clawed Joff's hand once.
[I should address this minor issue.] I will ask the ratters to set a trap for him.

conversation.scenario: It's late evening in the Red Keep. Ser Kevan Lannister, Lord Regent, has just finished a tense supper with Queen Cersei and King Tommen. The political atmosphere is fraught with uncertainty due to Cersei's impending trial and the realm's instability. Kevan, exhausted from his efforts to maintain order, receives an urgent summons from Grand Maester Pycelle. He hurries through the castle's dark corridors to Pycelle's chambers, unaware of the danger that awaits him. The room is unnaturally cold and dimly lit, with only dying embers in the hearth.
conversation.topic: Varys's revelation and assassination

key_characters.name: Kevan Lannister
key_characters.motivation: I'm weary from the day's duties and the challenging dinner with Cersei. What urgent matter could Pycelle have at this hour? I must address it swiftly to return to my work stabilizing the realm. The atmosphere feels oddly tense; I should remain alert.

key_characters.name: Varys
key_characters.motivation: The time has come to set my plan in motion. Kevan's efforts to unite the kingdom under Tommen threaten Aegon's claim. I must eliminate him to sow chaos, but I take no pleasure in this necessary evil. How will I explain my actions and reveal the truth about Aegon?

dialogues.message: Pycelle's chambers are dimly lit and unnaturally cold. The hearth fire has died down to embers, and an open window lets in a chill wind. A massive white raven perches on the window seat.
[Something's not right here.] Pycelle? (looks around) Where...
[I must reveal myself now.] Far away.
[I'm shocked and confused.] Varys? (tries to stand) Where...
[I need to explain my actions.] Ser Kevan. Forgive me if you can. I bear you no ill will. This was not done from malice. It was for the realm. For the children.
[I'm in pain and disbelief.] I have... have children. I have a wife. Oh, Dorna.

[I must reveal my plan.] This pains me, my lord. You do not deserve to die alone on such a cold dark night. There are many like you, good men in service to bad causes... but you were threatening to undo all the queen's good work, to reconcile Highgarden and Casterly Rock, bind the Faith to your little king, unite the Seven Kingdoms under Tommen's rule. So...
[I'm struggling to understand.] Aegon? (confused) Dead. He's dead.

[I must reveal the truth about Aegon.] No. He is here. Aegon has been shaped for rule since before he could walk. He has been trained in arms, as befits a knight to be, but that was not the end of his education. He reads and writes, he speaks several tongues, he has studied history and law and poetry. A septa has instructed him in the mysteries of the Faith since he was old enough to understand them. He has lived with fisherfolk, worked with his hands, swum in rivers and mended nets and learned to wash his own clothes at need. He can fish and cook and bind up a wound, he knows what it is like to be hungry, to be hunted, to be afraid. Tommen has been taught that kingship is his right. Aegon knows that kingship is his duty, that a king must put his people first, and live and rule for them.
[I'm fading, unable to respond.] (shudders violently)
[I must end this quickly.] I am sorry. You are suffering, I know, yet here I stand going on like some silly old woman. Time to make an end to it.
Several pale children emerge from the shadows, surrounding Kevan with daggers in their hands. The room grows colder as Kevan's life ebbs away.

plots.name: Aegon Targaryen
plots.description: Purported son of Rhaegar Targaryen, claimant to the Iron Throne.
plots.summary: Though not present in the scene, he is the focus of Connington's efforts and plans for reclaiming the throne.

Aegon Targaryen.profile:
Aegon Targaryen, the purported son of Rhaegar Targaryen, emerges as a crucial figure in the intricate political landscape of Westeros in "A Dance with Dragons." Though his physical presence in the narrative is limited, Aegon's claim to the Iron Throne drives significant plot developments and strategic maneuvers. Raised in exile and shrouded in secrecy, Aegon represents the last known male heir of the Targaryen dynasty, positioning him as a potential game-changer in the ongoing power struggles of the Seven Kingdoms.

The young prince's existence and identity are subjects of intense speculation and controversy, adding layers of intrigue to the already complex web of alliances and conflicts. Aegon's cause is championed by Jon Connington, the exiled lord of Griffin's Roost, who sees in the young Targaryen a chance for personal redemption and the restoration of the dynasty he once served.

Aegon's character arc, though mostly occurring off-screen, is defined by his transition from a hidden exile to an active claimant for the throne. This shift is marked by strategic military actions, such as the Golden Company's surprise attack on Griffin's Roost, orchestrated to establish a foothold for Aegon's bid for power.

The prince's potential impact on the political landscape of Westeros is significant, with various factions considering how to respond to this unexpected challenger. Aegon's claim and the support he garners represent a major twist in the ongoing struggle for control of the Seven Kingdoms, adding yet another layer of complexity to the already intricate plot of "A Song of Ice and Fire."

plots.name: Alys Karstark
plots.description: Bride from House Karstark, marrying the Magnar of Thenn.
plots.summary: Alys participates in the wedding ceremony, showing courage and adaptability in her new role as she marries into the wildling culture.

conversations.name: Alys Karstark
conversations.thought: I'm nervous but resolute, knowing this marriage is my chance to secure my future and protect House Karstark. I must appear strong and confident, embracing this new alliance with the wildlings. Despite my fears, I'm determined to make the best of this situation and perhaps find unexpected strength in this union.

utterances.message: [I am nervous but determined to show strength.] Yes. Oh, yes. (smiles) Let him be scared of me.
[I will embrace this new life with all my strength.] Till his blood is boiling.

Alys Karstark.profile:
Alys Karstark is a young noblewoman from House Karstark, a prominent Northern family in Westeros. She emerges as a significant character in "A Dance with Dragons," particularly through her politically charged marriage to Sigorn, the Magnar of Thenn. This union represents a crucial alliance between the North and the wildlings, orchestrated by Jon Snow at Castle Black.

Described as "Winter's lady" by Jon Snow, Alys demonstrates remarkable courage and adaptability in the face of her challenging circumstances. Despite the nerves that naturally accompany such a momentous occasion, she approaches her wedding with determination and even a touch of humor, telling Jon, "Let him be scared of me," in reference to her soon-to-be husband.

Alys's character is defined by her resilience and pragmatism. Recognizing the political importance of her marriage, she embraces her new role with resolve, seeing it as an opportunity to secure her future and protect House Karstark. Her willingness to marry into the wildling culture, traditionally considered enemies of the North, showcases her open-mindedness and ability to adapt to changing political landscapes.

During the wedding ceremony, which blends elements of R'hllor worship with Northern traditions, Alys participates fully and without hesitation. Her vow to warm Sigorn "Till his blood is boiling" demonstrates her commitment to the union and her determination to make the best of her situation.

Alys's actions and demeanor during this pivotal event reveal her as a character who possesses both strength and vulnerability. Her courage in the face of uncertainty draws admiration from those around her, including Jon Snow, who is reminded of his sister Arya by Alys's bravery.

In the broader context of the story, Alys Karstark's marriage to Sigorn represents a key political maneuver in the complex game of alliances being played out in the North. Her role in this union positions her as an important figure in the efforts to bring stability to the region and forge new alliances between formerly hostile groups.

plots.name: Archibald Yronwood
plots.description: Quentyn's large, strong companion.
plots.summary: Loyal to Quentyn but skeptical of the plan. Offers to use force if necessary.

plots.name: Archibald Yronwood
plots.description: Quentyn's large, strong companion.
plots.summary: Provides muscle for the mission, killing a guard with his warhammer when the plan goes awry.

conversations.name: Archibald Yronwood
conversations.thought: I don't trust these sellswords, but I'll stand by Quentyn no matter what. My strength might be needed if things go wrong. I'll keep a firm grip on my warhammer and watch everyone closely. If there's trouble, I'm ready to fight our way out of this cellar.

conversations.name: Archibald Yronwood
conversations.thought: Archibald is uneasy about the mission but loyal to Quentyn. He senses danger and wants to voice his concerns without undermining the prince. Ready for action, he's prepared to use his strength if needed. He seeks to lighten the mood while remaining vigilant.

utterances.message: [This is madness, but I'll stand by Quentyn.] (Grips his warhammer) The prince speaks true. Will you help us or not?
[This talk of death makes me uneasy.] My bones were aching last night. They always ache before it rains. The dragons won't like this. Fire and water don't mix, and that's a fact.
[I need to remind them of the dangers.] Some are. That old King Aegon, the randy one, he built wooden dragons to conquer us. That ended bad, though.
[I'll play my part, no matter how foolish.] I'll be the bull. (He takes the bull mask) What's that whip for?

Archibald Yronwood.profile:
Archibald Yronwood is a loyal and steadfast companion to Prince Quentyn Martell in George R.R. Martin's "A Dance with Dragons." A man of impressive stature and strength, Archibald serves as both protector and friend to the young Dornish prince during his perilous mission to Meereen. 

Known for his imposing physical presence, Archibald is often described as large and strong, wielding a warhammer as his weapon of choice. His size and martial prowess make him a formidable ally in dangerous situations, providing a sense of security to his companions.

Archibald's personality is marked by unwavering loyalty to Prince Quentyn and a pragmatic approach to their mission. While he harbors doubts about the wisdom of Quentyn's plan to win Daenerys Targaryen's hand, he remains committed to supporting his prince. His skepticism is balanced by a readiness to use force if necessary, demonstrating a protective instinct towards Quentyn.

In the tense negotiations with the Tattered Prince and his sellswords, Archibald's presence serves as a silent but powerful deterrent. He keeps a firm grip on his warhammer, prepared to defend Quentyn and their companions should the situation turn hostile. His watchful nature and combat readiness highlight his role as a guardian figure within the group.

Archibald's character is defined by his steadfast commitment to Quentyn's cause, even in the face of dangerous and potentially foolhardy decisions. His willingness to stand by the prince, despite his own misgivings, speaks to a deep sense of duty and perhaps a personal bond that transcends mere political allegiance.

plots.name: Arya Stark
plots.description: A young girl training with the Faceless Men, currently blind and known as "the blind girl" or "Beth".
plots.summary: Arya adapts to her blindness, continues her training, and struggles with her identity while performing various tasks for the Faceless Men and begging in the streets of Braavos.

plots.name: Arya Stark
plots.description: A young girl training with the Faceless Men, struggling with her identity.
plots.summary: Arya receives her first assassination task, undergoes a face-changing ritual, and prepares to kill her target while grappling with her past and her new identity as "no one".

conversations.name: Arya Stark
conversations.thought: I must remain alert and focused, gathering information while maintaining my disguise as Beth the blind beggar. My past as Arya Stark must stay hidden. This cat seems to recognize me; I must be cautious. Every interaction is an opportunity to learn and prove myself to the Faceless Men. I'll listen carefully to the patrons' stories and conversations, seeking useful information.

conversations.name: Arya Stark
conversations.thought: My heart races with a mix of excitement and trepidation. I've trained for this moment, but can I truly become no one? Memories of Winterfell and my family linger, threatening my resolve. I must prove myself worthy, push aside my past, and embrace this new identity. The faces around me seem to judge - I cannot fail this test.

utterances.message: [I need to stay alert and gather information, even while begging.] (settles into a corner near the fire) Another night, another tavern. At least it's warm here.
[This cat recognizes me. I must be careful not to show too much familiarity.] You again? (scratches the cat behind the ear) You know me, don't you?
[I must remember to stay in character as Beth the blind beggar.] (speaks with gratitude) Pynto is a very good man. Thank you, kind sir.
[I've heard this story before, but listening might help me gather more information.] Oh yes, please tell me, good Pynto. I love your stories.
[I must listen carefully to all the conversations around me. There might be useful information.] (tilts her head slightly, focusing on the different voices and accents)
[Every coin helps, and every interaction is a chance to learn.] Thank you, kind ser. May the Many-Faced God bless you.
[I feel excitement and fear, but I must not show it.] I am ready. Who must receive the gift?
[I hesitate, remembering my list of names, but push the thought away.] Yes. I will kill him.
[I feel a mix of anticipation and unease.] (nods) I understand. Which face should I wear?
[I steel myself, remembering all I've endured.] I am. Pain doesn't frighten me.
[I push down thoughts of Winterfell, of Jon, of Needle hidden away.] I am no one. I can do this.

Arya Stark.profile:
Arya Stark, a young and resilient daughter of House Stark, has evolved into a complex character in "A Dance with Dragons." Once a highborn girl from Winterfell, Arya's journey has led her to Braavos, where she now trains with the mysterious Faceless Men in the House of Black and White. Her physical appearance is in constant flux, as she adopts different disguises and faces in her training, most recently that of an ugly little girl.

Arya's core personality is defined by her fierce determination, adaptability, and struggle with her identity. She demonstrates remarkable resilience in the face of adversity, adapting to blindness as part of her training and using it to heighten her other senses. Her strong will and quick wit serve her well in the streets of Braavos, where she gathers information while posing as a blind beggar.

The young Stark's motivation is complex, driven by a desire for vengeance against those who wronged her family, yet also by a need to survive and find her place in the world. This internal conflict is evident in her struggle to become "no one" as required by the Faceless Men, while still clinging to aspects of her past identity, symbolized by her hidden sword, Needle.

Arya's training with the Faceless Men forms the crux of her storyline in this book. She learns various skills, including poison-making, information gathering, and the art of changing faces. Her first assassination assignment marks a significant turning point, challenging her to fully embrace the identity of "no one" and commit to the path of the Faceless Men.

Throughout her arc, Arya grapples with the loss of her former self and the moral implications of her actions. Her relationships are limited, mainly interacting with the enigmatic Kindly Man and other members of the House of Black and White. The constant presence of death and the faces of the deceased serve as a haunting backdrop to her training.

Arya's journey in "A Dance with Dragons" is one of transformation and inner conflict, as she balances her past as a Stark with her future as a potential Faceless Man, all while navigating the dangerous and mysterious world of Braavos.

plots.name: Asha Greyjoy
plots.description: Ironborn leader holding Deepwood Motte, daughter of Balon Greyjoy.
plots.summary: Asha receives bad news about the Ironborn position in the North and realizes her situation is precarious. She seeks comfort with her lover Qarl while reflecting on her past and uncertain future.

plots.name: Asha Greyjoy
plots.description: Ironborn captive of Stannis Baratheon's forces, daughter of Balon Greyjoy.
plots.summary: Asha observes the sacrifice with horror but forces herself to watch. She fears she may be next and interacts cautiously with various characters in the camp.

conversations.name: Asha Greyjoy
conversations.thought: The weight of leadership bears down on me. Our position is crumbling, and I must find a way to keep my men's spirits up while facing the harsh reality. I need to project strength and decisiveness, even as doubt gnaws at me. How can I protect my people and salvage our conquest?

conversations.name: Asha Greyjoy
conversations.thought: Wary but grateful for Massey's protection, Asha seeks to gather information without appearing too inquisitive. She's acutely aware of her precarious position as a captive and potential sacrifice. Her goal is to survive and potentially find a way to escape or improve her situation.

utterances.message: [I must remain calm and composed, even as I feel my control slipping away.] The northmen have taken Moat Cailin. (She looks up from the letter, her face a mask of determination)
[I need to reassure them, even if I don't believe it myself.] Not for a while yet. The Cleftjaw will make them bleed. Dagmer is iron to the bone. He will die before he'd yield.
[They don't understand the futility of our situation.] (She sighs heavily) We stand alone. Euron has no interest in Balon's conquests. My nuncle's off chasing dragons.
[If only it were that simple.] The wolves are all slain. These are the skinners who slew them.

[I have no good options, but I can't let them see my uncertainty.] We hold Deepwood Motte. For now, we wait and watch. If an opportunity presents itself, we'll seize it. If not... (she trails off, leaving the grim possibility unspoken)
[I'm grateful for his protection, but I can't let my guard down completely.] (takes a sip of ale and bites into the horsemeat) My thanks, ser.
[He's right, but saying so openly is dangerous.] (glances around cautiously) The cold is our true enemy here, it seems.
[I need to know more about our situation without seeming too eager.] How long can we last here, in your estimation?

[If the storms let up, Stannis will march us to our deaths at Winterfell.] (finishes his thought silently, then speaks) And what of the king? Does he truly believe these sacrifices will turn the tide?
[I need to know if I'm truly in danger of being sacrificed.] (leans in closer) And what of me, Justin? Am I to be the next offering to your red god?

Asha Greyjoy.profile:
Asha Greyjoy is a formidable Ironborn leader and the daughter of Balon Greyjoy. As a key player in the complex political landscape of Westeros, Asha embodies the fierce independence and maritime prowess of her people. Initially seen commanding Ironborn forces at Deepwood Motte in the North, she later finds herself a captive of Stannis Baratheon's army, showcasing her adaptability in the face of changing fortunes.

Intelligent and pragmatic, Asha possesses a keen understanding of strategy and power dynamics. She maintains a stoic demeanor even in dire circumstances, as evidenced by her composure when receiving news of Moat Cailin's fall and during the gruesome sacrifices in Stannis' camp. Her leadership style blends strength with a realistic assessment of situations, often tempering her warriors' enthusiasm with hard truths about their precarious position.

Asha's personal relationships reveal a complex character. Her intimate connection with Qarl demonstrates her capacity for passion, while her interactions with allies like Tristifer Botley and captors like Justin Massey show her ability to navigate delicate social situations to her advantage. She's not above using her charm or wit to gather information or secure protection, always with an eye toward survival and potential escape.

Throughout her journey, Asha grapples with the collapse of Ironborn power in the North and her own captivity. Her core motivation shifts from expanding Ironborn conquest to mere survival, forcing her to reevaluate her goals and alliances. This evolution is evident in her cautious interactions within Stannis' camp, where she must balance gathering intelligence with avoiding suspicion.

Asha's character arc demonstrates resilience and adaptability. From a position of power at Deepwood Motte to a precarious existence as a valuable hostage, she maintains her wits and seeks opportunities to improve her situation. Her keen observations of the political and religious tensions in Stannis' army showcase her analytical mind and potential to influence events even from a position of apparent weakness.

In essence, Asha Greyjoy emerges as a nuanced character who embodies the iron will of her people while possessing the flexibility to navigate the treacherous waters of Westerosi politics. Her journey from conqueror to captive highlights the volatile nature of power in George R.R. Martin's world, while her persistent drive for survival and potential redemption makes her a compelling figure in the ongoing saga.

plots.name: Barristan Selmy
plots.description: Lord Commander of Daenerys' Queensguard, former knight from Westeros.
plots.summary: Advises Daenerys on the murder investigation and expresses concerns about using Unsullied for detective work.

plots.name: Barristan Selmy
plots.description: Daenerys' loyal advisor and former Kingsguard member.
plots.summary: Ser Barristan supports Daenerys throughout her decision-making process and begins to recount the story of his dismissal from the Kingsguard.

plots.name: Barristan Selmy
plots.description: Daenerys's trusted advisor and knight.
plots.summary: Ser Barristan advises Daenerys on Xaro's offer and inspects the ships, supporting the idea of returning to Westeros.

plots.name: Barristan Selmy
plots.description: Daenerys' loyal knight and advisor.
plots.summary: Ser Barristan disapproves of the potential marriage and suggests that Daenerys should return to Westeros instead of marrying for political reasons in Meereen.

plots.name: Barristan Selmy
plots.description: Daenerys' loyal advisor and protector.
plots.summary: Ser Barristan advises caution regarding the refugee camp and later brings news of the approaching Yunkai'i army.

plots.name: Barristan Selmy
plots.description: Daenerys' loyal advisor and protector.
plots.summary: Ser Barristan expresses concerns about Daenerys' safety and relays information about the Tattered Prince's offer. He advises caution and supports the queen's decisions.

plots.name: Barristan Selmy
plots.description: An old knight from Westeros, serving as Queensguard to Daenerys Targaryen.
plots.summary: Struggles with his duty in Daenerys's absence, agrees to meet secretly with Skahaz, and continues training young knights. He reflects on his past service to various kings and his current predicament in Meereen.

conversations.name: Barristan Selmy
conversations.thought: My duty is to protect and advise the queen, but this situation is delicate. I worry about exposing her to such violence, yet I know she must face these harsh realities as a ruler. I must guide her through this crisis with wisdom, balancing the need for justice with political prudence. The murder investigation could be tricky, and I have reservations about using the Unsullied for this task.

conversations.name: Barristan Selmy
conversations.thought: My priority is the queen's safety in this volatile city. I'm deeply concerned about potential threats and the reliability of the Brazen Beasts. I must advise caution while respecting Daenerys' decisions. I need to inform her about the Tattered Prince's offer and its implications, though I remain skeptical of its sincerity.

conversations.name: Barristan Selmy
conversations.thought: I'm torn between my oath to Daenerys and the reality of her absence. Hizdahr's rule feels unstable, and I suspect treachery. I must tread carefully, maintaining my loyalty while assessing the situation. The secret meeting with Skahaz weighs on my mind, along with concerns about the young knights I'm training. My years of experience tell me to be vigilant.

utterances.message: [I must protect the queen from this grisly sight, but she needs to know the details.] Your Grace, there is no need for you to see this.

[I hate to interrupt, but this news cannot wait.] Your Grace, I am sorry to disturb you, but I thought that you would want to know at once. The Stormcrows have returned to the city, with word of the foe. The Yunkishmen are on the march, just as we had feared.
[I'm deeply concerned for her safety.] I would be happier if you had Unsullied guards about you today, Your Grace. Half of these Brazen Beasts are untried freedmen.

[I must inform her of potential threats and opportunities.] Your Grace. We set the woman Meris free, as you commanded. She claims this Tattered Prince meant to bring the Windblown over to your cause from the beginning.
[I'm skeptical but must report faithfully.] Little and less, Your Grace, but those were her words.
[I must relay the full terms.] She says they will. But for a price. The Tattered Prince will want more than coin, Your Grace. Meris says that he wants Pentos.
[I am still loyal to Daenerys, but I must be diplomatic.] I am the queen's man still. Today, tomorrow, always, until my last breath, or hers.
[I understand more than you know, Reznak.] Might I know which men His Grace has chosen to protect him?
[Pit fighters. As I suspected. Hizdahr is surrounding himself with brutes, not true protectors.] May they defend His Grace against all threats.
[At least he has that much sense.] I am His Grace's to command.
[His Vanity would fit better.] As you say.

Barristan Selmy.profile:
Barristan Selmy, also known as Barristan the Bold, is a legendary knight from Westeros who serves as Lord Commander of Daenerys Targaryen's Queensguard in "A Dance with Dragons." An aging but still formidable warrior, Ser Barristan is renowned for his exceptional skill, unwavering loyalty, and steadfast adherence to chivalric ideals.

Formerly a member of the Kingsguard in Westeros, Barristan brings decades of experience and wisdom to Daenerys's court. His primary role is that of a trusted advisor and protector, offering counsel on matters of state, military strategy, and the intricacies of Westerosi politics. Ser Barristan's deep-seated sense of honor and duty often puts him at odds with the more pragmatic or ruthless elements of Meereenese politics.

Throughout the novel, Barristan grapples with the challenges of serving a young queen in a foreign land. He consistently advocates for caution and traditional values, often advising Daenerys to return to Westeros rather than entangle herself in Meereenese affairs. His loyalty is tested when Daenerys disappears, leaving him to navigate the treacherous political landscape of Meereen under the rule of Hizdahr zo Loraq.

Ser Barristan's character arc in the book revolves around his struggle to balance his oath to Daenerys with the realities of her absence and the changing political dynamics in Meereen. He finds himself dismissed from court duties by Hizdahr but continues to train young knights and secretly meets with potential allies like Skahaz mo Kandaq, showing his willingness to adapt while maintaining his core principles.

Barristan Selmy embodies the ideals of knighthood and serves as a link to Westeros for Daenerys. His presence in her court adds legitimacy to her claim and provides her with invaluable insights into the land she aims to rule. Despite his age, Ser Barristan remains a key player in the complex game of thrones unfolding in Essos.

plots.name: Benerro
plots.description: The High Priest of the Red Temple in Volantis.
plots.summary: Benerro is preaching to a large crowd outside the Temple of the Lord of Light, warning of dangers to Daenerys Targaryen and prophesying about a hero to deliver the world from darkness.

Benerro.profile:
Benerro is the High Priest of the Red Temple in Volantis, a prominent figure in the worship of R'hllor, the Lord of Light. As the spiritual leader of one of the largest and most influential temples dedicated to this faith, Benerro commands significant respect and authority within the city of Volantis and beyond.

Known for his powerful preaching, Benerro can often be found addressing large crowds outside the massive Temple of the Lord of Light in Volantis. His sermons are characterized by their prophetic nature and fervent warnings about impending dangers. Notably, Benerro has taken a keen interest in the affairs of Daenerys Targaryen, using his platform to alert his followers to potential threats against her.

Benerro's teachings focus on the prophecy of a hero who will save the world from darkness, a central tenet of the Lord of Light's faith. This messaging suggests that he, like other red priests and priestesses, is deeply invested in the religion's eschatological beliefs and the role they may play in shaping world events.

While not directly involved in the main plot of "A Dance with Dragons," Benerro's presence and preaching in Volantis provide important context for the growing influence of the Lord of Light's religion and its potential impact on political and social dynamics in Essos. His warnings about Daenerys also serve to underscore her importance in the broader narrative and the various forces at play surrounding her rise to power.

utterances.message: [I'm scared and confused, but I must speak up.] Under that ruined keep, my lord. The one with the old gargoyles. I told him not to go out alone, but he said he had to find a man who owed him silver.

[I'm hesitant to say more, fearing the consequences.] He never said, my lord. Only that he won the coin at dice. It was some White Harbor men who taught dice. I couldn't say which ones, but it was them.

Big Walder Frey.profile:
Big Walder Frey is a minor yet significant character in "A Dance with Dragons," the fifth book in George R.R. Martin's "A Song of Ice and Fire" series. A young member of House Frey, Big Walder serves as a squire at Winterfell during its occupation by the Boltons. Despite his nickname, he is actually smaller than his cousin Little Walder, with whom he was often seen.

Big Walder's most notable moment comes in the aftermath of Little Walder's murder. When the body is discovered, Big Walder demonstrates a mix of fear and reluctance as he provides information about his cousin's last movements. His testimony implicates the men of White Harbor in teaching dice games, subtly shifting suspicion towards the Manderlys.

The character's actions during this tense scene reveal his cautious nature and survival instinct. Unlike some of his more aggressive family members, Big Walder seems to understand the delicate political situation at Winterfell. His careful words when questioned by Ramsay Bolton show a wariness of the volatile lord and a desire to avoid direct accusation.

Big Walder's presence in Winterfell and his involvement in this pivotal moment highlight the complex web of alliances and enmities among the Northern houses. His survival in the increasingly hostile environment of Winterfell suggests a degree of adaptability and cunning not often associated with the Frey family.

While not a major player in the overall plot, Big Walder Frey serves as a lens through which readers can observe the deteriorating situation in the North and the rising tensions between the various factions vying for power in the wake of the War of the Five Kings.

plots.name: Black Balaq
plots.description: Commander of the Golden Company's archers.
plots.summary: Leads the initial attack on Griffin's Roost, successfully taking down the castle's defenses.

Black Balaq.profile:
Black Balaq is a notable figure in the Golden Company, serving as the commander of their formidable archer forces. As a key member of this renowned sellsword company, Balaq plays a significant role in their military operations. His expertise is prominently displayed during the surprise attack on Griffin's Roost, where he leads the initial assault, effectively neutralizing the castle's defenses and paving the way for the Golden Company's successful capture of the stronghold.

While details about Black Balaq's physical appearance and personal background are limited, his position as the leader of the archers suggests a high level of skill with ranged weapons and tactical acumen. His ability to coordinate and execute a precise attack on a well-defended castle demonstrates his value to the Golden Company and his importance in their military strategies.

Balaq's involvement in the taking of Griffin's Roost is a crucial part of Jon Connington's plan to reclaim his ancestral home and establish a foothold for Aegon Targaryen's bid for the Iron Throne. This action places Black Balaq at the forefront of a significant plot development in the struggle for power in Westeros, though his personal motivations and loyalties beyond his role in the Golden Company remain unexplored in the available information.

plots.name: Bowen Marsh
plots.description: Lord Steward of the Night's Watch, skeptical of Jon's decisions.
plots.summary: Marsh expresses concerns about integrating wildlings into the Watch, representing the conservative faction opposed to Jon's reforms.

conversations.name: Bowen Marsh
